Identifies and troubleshoots data integration and integrity issues in cooperation with the appropriate business units
Analyze requirements and develop test plans that address areas such as database impacts, user software scenarios, regression testing, negative testing, error or bug retests, or usability.
Access data bases and perform SQL queries, to perform data integrity checks and validate logic of data inputted into databases to the displaying of the data in a web application within the testing life cycle.
Understand formulas designed by Business Analysts to ensure the development team has implemented them correctly in the code and how the data is represented.
Use query techniques and available tools, against our product and enterprise data warehouse system, to identify and analyze data quality issues.
Responsible for reviewing the referential and historical integrity of product and data warehouse information.
Analyze application requirements to understand what is needed to set up for a system under test including hardware setup, user setup, and data analysis.
Perform initial debugging procedures by reviewing configuration files, or logs.
Engage with Product Management and Development Management learning in Software Lifecycle to ensure QA communications are represented throughout the products they help manage.
Improve upon the automation test framework by supplying updated processes and knowledge to improve automation coverage of all products.
Analyze requirements and develop test plans that address areas such as database impacts, user software scenarios, regression testing, negative testing, error or bug retests, or usability.
Access databases and perform queries into Snowflake and Databricks, to perform data integrity checks and validate the logic of data inputted into databases to the display of the data in a web application within the testing life cycle.
Understand formulas designed by Business Analysts to ensure the development team has implemented them correctly in the code and how the data is represented.
Use query techniques and available tools, against our product and enterprise data warehouse system, to identify and analyze data quality issues.
Responsible for reviewing the referential and historical integrity of product and data warehouse information.
Analyze application requirements to understand what is needed to set up a system under test including hardware setup, user setup, and data analysis.
Perform initial debugging procedures by reviewing configuration files, or logs.
Build an automated use case database that can be used for regression testing in the future to ensure results are as expected with future releases of the software.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in the fields of Computer Science or Computer Engineering or Mathematics or Statistics or related experience.
5 years of experience working in a Quality Assurance Data Analyst Role.
Understanding of healthcare data, having experience working with healthcare claims.
Strong SQL querying skills specifically for QA checks within Snowflake and Databricks instances.
5 years working with software development life cycle and knowledge of testing aspects of the cycle along with best practices for client data testing.
At least 3 years working with automation tools such as QTP, and Test Complete along with knowledge of best practices.
Ability to work with Snowflake, Redshift, and other MPP databases.

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we're committed to a process of continuous innovation and improvement in our user experience and safety controls. We also take our responsibility to safeguard our community seriously, both in how we address potentially harmful content and how we protect against unauthorized access to user data.

U.S. Data Security (“USDS”) is a standalone department of TikTok in the U.S. This new security-first division was created to bring heightened focus and governance to our data protection policies and content assurance protocols to keep U.S. users safe. Our focus is on providing oversight and protection of the TikTok platform and user data in the U.S., so millions of Americans can continue turning to TikTok to learn something new, earn a living, express themselves creatively, or be entertained. The teams within USDS that deliver on this commitment daily span Trust & Safety, Security & Privacy, Engineering, User & Product Ops, Corporate Functions and more.

In order to enhance collaboration and cross-functional partnerships, among other things, at this time, our organization follows a hybrid work schedule that requires employees to work in the office 3 days a week, or as directed by their manager/department. We regularly review our hybrid work model, and the specific requirements may change at any time.

Job Description:
The Role
Operations Quantitative Research and Investments (QRI) is seeking a highly motivated data expert to build out data quality rules, investigate potential data quality issues, and work with both internal and external partners to correct data issues to ensure that all information required for the investment management process including positions, security data, pricing, risk, cash, NAV, performance, compliance, and vendor data are delivered consistently, accurately and on a timely basis, and supported.
This role is an opportunity for a motivated individual with strong analytical skills and attention to detail to develop substantial domain expertise in datasets that are central to the quantitative investment process, and solve complex problems in a fast-paced environment that have an important impact on both quantitative research and our customers’ portfolios.
The Value You Deliver
Contribute to the stewardship of data assets used in research and production of quantitative investment models
Support the data certification effort, receiving new datasets and associated DQ systems from the Data Engineering team and exercising them to certify historical data and build knowledge of the dataset
Independently respond to data quality issues in overnight feeds, enabling fast and seamless responses to upstream issues and insulating production and research from them
Enable QRI’s access to clean, timely and relevant data, working closely with key technology and business partners to correct data quality issues at source • Support data stewardship services to help researchers consume new datasets and uncover value
Analyze systems and processes to find efficiencies and improve accuracy and timeliness of reporting
The Expertise and Skills You Bring
Highly analytical with the ability to quickly comprehend large data sets, develop and implement the right quality controls for these datasets
Highly proactive and self-motivated with the ability to meet objectives independently, with great attention to detail and commitment to high-level goals
Experience with vendor-provided data, including FactSet, Bloomberg, IBES, CompStat, S&P Global, Worldscope, Morningstar, MSCI, Reuters, IDC, Markit
Experience with market risk data vendors, including BARRA, Axioma, Northfield, PORT is a plus
Experience in security, company, portfolio, and index-level information used in financial industry
Experience in SQL, Python, Snowflake and / or Oracle and related tools. Exposure to DQ frameworks is a plus
2+ years’ experience in data operations and/or support teams with a demonstrable track record delivering the value
Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in mathematics, statistics, engineering, computer science, finance, or another quantitative field
Exposure to methods, tools, statistics, and best practices for autonomous and discretionary anomaly detection, and data quality workflow is a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; experience working with both technical and investment teams
Proven track record of working with complex data environments and associated technology and analytics infrastructure needed to support these environments
Demonstrated ability to root-cause data quality issues in complex environments and work with other teams and data providers to correct issues at source
Familiarity with creating automated processes to identify errors to ensure high quality of data to support the investment process
Experience in documenting essential procedures and calculations, and validating data
Investment Management business domain expertise across some combination of research, portfolio management, trading and investment operations
The Team
The Data Operations team is an integral part of the Quantitative Research and Investing (QRI) division in Asset Management. QRI is responsible for the management and development of quantitative investment strategies and solutions while providing high quality quantitative, data-driven support to Fidelity’s fundamental investment professionals, ensuring they have access to the most relevant data and advanced quantitative analysis. The Data Operations team partners with and supports all the teams within QRI including Systematic Equity Strategies, Systematic Fixed Income Strategies, Quant Index Solutions, Embedded Equity and Embedded Fixed Income, and Advanced Strategies and Research
Certifications:
Company Overview
Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients' money.

Join Us
At Fidelity, you'll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples' lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees' Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a Best Place to Work in 2023. Most associates will have a hybrid schedule with a requirement to work onsite at a Fidelity work location for at least one week, 5 consecutive days, every four weeks. These requirements are subject to change.

Data & Platforms Analyst
This position is directly responsible for providing operations and senior leadership with accurate reporting, predictive analytics and performing analysis (with suggestions) on menu items, production quantities, guest sentiment and other. Additionally, the position is also responsible for updating and maintaining our Point of Sale and App platforms. The data & platforms analyst is a critical position for predicting accurate production quantities for operations to meet sales projections and reduce/eliminate waste.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsible for providing operations with a by-store production forecast of donuts and baked goods to be produced on a twice-weekly basis and provide insight and analysis on trends to drive more informed business decisions related to item performance on our menu.
Provide accurate production planning and demand forecasting for each location to meet projected sales and reduce waste by utilizing a MTS (Make to Stock) model.
Collect, review, analyze and compare production vs waste by store and provide (with analysis) to operations.
Perform a daily platforms audit that includes: o Auditing all delivery platforms by store to ensure all menu items are available for sale, that delivery radiuses are correct and that all stores are online.
Perform a weekly platforms/operations audit that includes: o Order accuracy, platform downtime, driver/pickup wait time, order cancellations, and item-level sentiment ratings.
Complete weekly and monthly closing activities related to menu production, identifying areas of improvement to increase sales and minimize waste.
Work hand-in-hand with a development team to build an in-house application that can use predictive analytics and AI to simplify (and in a more streamlined way) demand plan at the store- level
Create monthly product mix & channel reporting for all stores that provide insight into possible trends and areas of opportunity. Including: o Top & bottom performing items, menu group performance, daypart trends, channel mix
(in-store, pickup, delivery), and impact on guest visit frequency from specific menu changes.
Provide operations leaders with production information and analysis data as requested.
Provide finance team with a weekly summary of production numbers by-store (for the purpose of raw good allocations)
Define seasonality/holiday assumptions to better predict item-level demand, by store, based on impacts from seasonality and holidays
Use our guest sentiment aggregation platform to provide weekly reporting on guest feedback per store and analyze this feedback to provide specific key trends and opportunities of focus.
Work with the supply chain team to continuously update demand forecasts for packaging and the top utilized raw goods, taking into account seasonality and new store openings/growth
Manage inventory and prevent stock-outs, review for obsolete items in Parsley and ensure that inventory items are up to date.
Evaluating/analyzing product costing standards and allocations of costs and labor.

Must have previous experience in production scheduling/forecasting in a manufacturing environment, bakery/hospitality preferred.
4-year college degree in Business, Accounting or Analytics is preferred but not required if work experience is sufficient.
Superior analytical skills
Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing methodologies a plus.
Great communication skills - Must be able to collaborate and build positive relationships with other teams within Operations, Catering and Finance departments to effectively make recommendations and implement process improvements.
Excellent computer and Excel skills.
Ability to handle multiple tasks/projects at once.
Previous experience with production systems, specifically production planning, manufacturing orders, and material requirements.
Knowledge and expertise in supporting large scale production teams.
Ability to lead and collaborate with internal/external teams.
Maintain interfaces with production leaders in all the geographical areas.
Excellent written/verbal communication skills

Work with different members of the CS&L team on reporting and automating analytical needs.

Proficient in SAP, Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, email.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills.

Overview

Baylor St. Luke’s Medical Center is an internationally recognized leader in research and clinical excellence that has given rise to breakthroughs in cardiovascular care neuroscience oncology transplantation and more. Our team’s efforts have led to the creation of many research programs and initiatives to develop advanced treatments found nowhere else in the world. In our commitment to advancing standards in an ever-evolving healthcare environment our new McNair Campus is designed around the human experience—modeled on evidence-based practices for the safety of patients visitors staff and physicians. The 27.5-acre campus represents the future of healthcare through a transformative alliance focused on leading-edge patient care research and education. Our strong alliance with Texas Heart® Institute and Baylor College of Medicine allows us to bring our patients a powerful network of care unlike any other. Our collaboration is focused on increasing access to care through a growing network of leading specialists and revolutionizing healthcare to save lives and improve the health of the communities we serve.

Responsibilities

Quality Data Analyst collects and evaluates clinical data as a part of the Performance Improvement Program.

ESSENTIAL KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Develop and maintain expert knowledge of measure and indicator specific inclusion and exclusion criteria for assigned measure sets.
2. Abstraction of both electronic and paper patient records based on established tools.
3. Data entry into web tools of required data elements as specified by assigned national data bases and/or clinical registries.
4. Conduct quality control audits of data entry via the web tool to assure accuracy of data entry.
5. Correct or assist in resolution of data quality errors and transmission errors prior to upload of data.
6. Participate in activities related to CMS validation audits.
7. Participate in internal reliability studies on data abstraction.
8. Participate in CPT meetings by providing education to hospital staff keeping the team apprised of changes or pending changes to measurement requirements.
9. Assist in problem solving and formulation of performance improvement strategies related to compliance with measurement specifications.

Qualifications

Education and Experience Required:
Associate's Degree in Nursing ‐OR‐ Master's Degree in Healthcare related field (MPH, MHA)
Three (3) years of related work experience
Preferred: Clinical experience

Minimum Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Computer keyboarding skills, knowledge of basic Word, Excel and Power Point, knowledge and understanding of medical terminology and familiarity with medical records, ability to interact effectively with healthcare providers of all disciplines, excellent time management and organizational skills

About This Role
Strava is the leading social platform for athletes and the largest sports community in the world, with US offices located in San Francisco and Denver and over 100 million athletes in 195 countries. If you sweat, you’re an athlete, and Strava’s mobile apps and website connect millions of active people every day.
We are looking for an experienced analyst in a full-time role to be a key member of one of our cross-functional product teams. You will collaborate with product managers, engineers, designers, and researchers to accelerate learning, make data-informed decisions, and define data-inspired solutions to meet athlete needs. This role reports to an analytics manager and partners tightly with cross-functional collaborators throughout the company.

You’re excited about this opportunity because you will:
Analyze data to produce insights that shape our understanding of our athletes, their usage patterns, and opportunities to improve their experience.
Collaborate closely with product managers and cross-functional partners to inform decisions and set strategy within a product team.
Advise business partners on A/B test design and interpretation while upholding experimentation best practices within and across teams.
Evaluate data tracking and quality on product surfaces, and collaborate with engineers to implement solutions where needed.
Provide the “source of truth” for internal consumers by owning critical analytical reporting and building exploratory dashboards.
Collaborate with the rest of the data organization at Strava (e.g. machine learning, data platform) to improve our technological craftsmanship.
We’re excited about you because:
You have 3+ years of experience in analytics, data science, or other quantitative domains. Experience in consumer-facing businesses is a plus.
You are a strong communicator with an orientation towards impact, and you are comfortable working both cross-functionally and independently.
You have a deep understanding of data pipeline concepts (e.g. ETL, scripting common analysis workflows).
You are highly proficient with SQL and have experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau).
You have hands-on experience with experimentation, including design, implementation, and methodologies (e.g. hypothesis testing and regression analysis) for analyzing and interpreting results to stakeholders.
You have hands-on experience working with statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python) for data wrangling and modeling.
You are comfortable managing concurrent projects and meeting goals, even in the context of competing deadlines or priorities.
About Strava
Strava is Swedish for “strive,” which epitomizes who we are and what we do. We’re a passionate and committed team, unified by our mission to connect athletes to what motivates them and help them find their personal best. With billions of activity uploads from all over the world, we have a humbling and adventurous vision: to be the record of the world’s athletic activities and the technology that makes every effort count.
Strava builds software that makes the best part of our athletes’ days even better. Just as we’re deeply committed to unlocking their potential, we’re dedicated to providing a world-class, inclusive workplace where our employees can grow and thrive, too. We’re backed by Sequoia Capital, Madrone Partners and Jackson Square Ventures, and we’re expanding in order to exceed the needs of our growing community of global athletes. Our culture reflects our community. We are continuously striving to hire and engage diverse teammates from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives because we know we are a stronger team together.
In light of the global pandemic, Strava is currently working in a fully remote capacity. As always, we remain committed to fully supporting our employees, especially their mental health and wellbeing, through these challenging times. Despite challenges in the world around us, we are continuing to grow camaraderie and positivity within our culture, and we are unified in our commitment to becoming an antiracist company. We are differentiated by our truly people-first approach, our compassionate leadership, and our belief that we can bring joy and inspiration to athletes’ lives — now more than ever. All to say, it’s a great time to join Strava!
Strava is an equal opportunity employer. In keeping with the values of Strava, we make all employment decisions including hiring, evaluation, termination, promotional and training opportunities, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, physical handicap, mental disability, medical condition, disability, gender or identity or expression, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, marital status, height and/or weight.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Department Description
The Andrews Lab focuses on determining the causal pathways that underly the development of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias (ADRD) by applying statistical genetic and genetic epidemiological approaches to large genetic & phenotypic datasets. Currently funded NIH-NIA and Alzheimer’s Association projects include (1) identifying causal risk factors for ADRD using genetic correlations, polygenic risk scores and mendelian randomization; (2) understanding the role of mitochondrial genomics in ADRD pathogenesis; and (3) evaluating specific effects of AD genetic variants on AD endophenotypes.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in statistical genetics, bioinformatics, biostatistics, computer science, data science or similar quantitative field OR four years of equivalent experience.
Acquiring knowledge of research function.
Acquiring the ability to perform research analysis duties.
Acquiring skills in statistical analysis, programming (e.g Python) and statistical computing (e.g. R).
Ability to effectively manage time and see assigned parts of projects through to completion on deadline.
Basic consultation and excellent communication skills.
Ability to work onsite in our San Francisco office when needed.
Note: We are not sponsoring any type of work VISA's.
Preferred Qualifications
Acquiring skill to to evaluate alternate solutions and develop recommendations
About UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.
Pride Values
UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. job_description:
Job Title: Business Analyst

Job Summary: This role will report to the Director - Business Analytics. As part of a coordinated analysis function scaled to support needs across the business, this analyst role will focus on key areas of opportunity including ticket pricing, customer segmentation and profiling, and fan engagement impact. With a scope of contribution that spans from growing ticket revenue, to deepening engagement and growing lifetime value of millions of Royals fans, and beyond, this function will make critical contributions working with Ticketing, Sales, Event Planning, Logistics & Marketing in support of helping business departments reach their goals and objectives.

Position Accountabilities/Responsibilities:
Gather analysis needs and requirements from multiple stakeholders across the business.
Discuss and clearly communicate analysis approaches and frameworks with key business stakeholders and gain buy-in on analysis process.
Obtain and synthesize data needed to perform analysis, with a focus on repeatability and ongoing production of key areas of analysis.
Develop models and approaches to analyzing data which, in combination with additional research and feedback, produces meaningful insights and trends that are leverageable in organizational decision making.
Work closely with the broader strategy and analytics functions to package and present thought leadership and points of view to key stakeholders

Position Qualifications, Skills, and Experience Required:
Undergraduate degree in business, economics, mathematics, statistics, engineering, or similar, accompanied by 1-3 years of professional experience during or after conclusion of degree program with emphasis on data manipulation and/or analysis
Effective communication skills and collaborative mindset
Ability to effectively decompose complex problems into manageable components and then build back up to a comprehensive recommendation and set of insights.
Proven ability and desire to manage multiple concurrent workstreams and engage broadly across the organization.
Experience with SQL and/or related programming language a plus
Experience with data visualizations, especially Tableau, Power BI or similar
Experience with product pricing, demand modelling, & customer segmentation all a plus.

Physical Requirements:
Must be able to work extended hours and/or weekends as required by deadlines and event scheduling
Ability to lift items weighing as much as 25 pounds
Must be able to work in a seated position for majority of workday
Must be able to be productive utilizing a computer keyboard and telephone
Must be able to be productive in a work environment where the noise level can be high at times
Must be comfortable walking to navigate the facility to access the office, concourse, etc.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that may be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to see, talk, and hear. The employee frequently is required to sit for long periods of time; walk; use hands, handle, or feel.

This role is a Full-Time, Exempt opportunity that is eligible for Company Benefits, 401K, and PTO. This role is expected to have a standard 40-hour work week.

Site Impact is seeking a dedicated and results-driven Data Analyst to join our team. As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in our organization by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to inform strategic decision-making across various departments.

Collaborate with teams across the company to gather and compile data from various sources, ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Utilize statistical analysis and data visualization techniques to interpret data and identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and reporting systems to support data-driven decision-making.
Design and develop data visualizations, charts, and graphs to convey complex information in a clear and understandable manner.
Conduct predictive analysis to identify potential future trends and opportunities.
Clean, transform, and preprocess data to prepare it for analysis, ensuring data integrity.
Integrate data from multiple sources and systems and troubleshoot data-related issues.
Implement and maintain data governance practices to ensure data accuracy, security, and compliance.
Collaborate with department heads and leadership to provide data-driven insights and recommendations.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
Proven experience as a data analyst or in a related role.
Experience working with financial planning and analytics
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI).
Strong knowledge of data management and database systems (SQL, NoSQL).
Familiarity with statistical analysis and predictive modeling.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
Effective communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.

DEFTEC delivers mission-critical solutions through skillfully delivered services and innovative products. This position directly supports Allied Command Transformation (ACT) which is NATO's leading agent for change: driving, facilitating, and advocating the continuous improvement of Alliance capabilities to maintain and enhance the military relevance and effectiveness of the Alliance. The main objectives of ACT are: providing appropriate support to NATO missions and operations; leading NATO military transformation; improving relationships, interaction and practical cooperation with partners, nations and international organizations.
The Data Analyst / Engineer provides support of all Net Assessment efforts, providing assessments of adversary's long-term trajectories and promoting high-level strategic thinking through providing data analytical support. Plan, prepare, coordinate and conduct Net Assessment analysis, as directed.

Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases
Support strategic foresight analysis with qualitative and quantitative assessments
Support comparative analysis through cross-directorate coordination at NATO ACT, as required,
Formulate actionable proposals to develop data analysis and exploitation in Strategic Foresight and Net Assessment practices.
Cooperate and assist in developing and maintaining NATO Net Assessment community of interest.

U.S. Citizen
Active Secret Clearance
Demonstrated experience in qualitative and quantitative analysis, including mathematical, statistical and general research.
Demonstrated ability to select, develop and employ analytical tools.
University degree in data sciences or equivalent.

Demonstrated ability of disciplined and systematic approach to problem solving

Fujitsu at a Glance
Fujitsu is a leading information and communication technology (ICT) company, headquartered in Japan, offering a full range of technology products, solutions, and services. With a spirit of challenge, we are committed to the continuous creation of new value. Fujitsu wants innovators like you!

Fujitsu, a leading technology company, is looking for a dynamic Sales Data Analyst to transform our approach to data analysis and elevate our sales operations. We are seeking a motivated individual who is not just a number cruncher, but a strategic thinker capable of high-level visibility, project management, and strong executive functions. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical skills, be proactive, exhibit excellent organizational prowess, feel at ease presenting to C-Level executives, and adeptly manage multiple workstreams.

Duties and Responsibilities
Strategic Data Analysis: Utilize advanced analytical techniques to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets, enabling data-driven decision-making at the highest level.
Project Management: Lead and drive various strategic projects, collaborating cross-functionally to ensure their successful execution. Manage project timelines, resources, and deliverables effectively.
Executive-level Reporting: Create compelling reports and presentations tailored for executive stakeholders, effectively communicating insights and recommendations to drive business growth.
High-Level Visibility: Act as a key liaison between sales operations and executive leadership, providing strategic insights and recommendations to optimize sales performance.
Efficiency Enhancement: Identify opportunities to streamline processes, enhance efficiency, and improve overall sales team productivity through data analysis and process optimization.

Requirements
Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, ITS, or related major. Minimum GPA of 3.0.
Technical Proficiency: Proficient in programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, and Scala. Familiarity with business intelligence tools, especially Tableau.
Analytical Skills: Strong mathematical background, including statistics and algebra. Exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable presenting complex data and insights to C-Level executives.
Organization: Detail-oriented with outstanding organizational skills, capable of handling multiple complex workstreams simultaneously.

ESG Data Analyst:
The ESG Data Analyst will report to the Global Sustainability Director as part of the Global Sustainability team. The successful candidate will help ensure progress on our global ESG journey is supported by quality data that will provide increased value to our customers while helping ensure compliance with increased ESG-based regulations.

What You'll Do:
Processing and analyzing ESG data for input into the Salesforce, Net-Zero Cloud software
Improving and implementing ESG data management processes
Conducting internal checks and verification on submitted ESG data and supporting evidence
Supporting increased capabilities of the NZC software as system representative
Support internal and external auditing of data as part of broader ESG reporting
Performs other related duties as required or requested.

Hiring for: Data Analyst
Do you have experience with data collection, interpretation, and complex analysis? Centre Area Transportation Authority (CATA) may have a job for you! The Data Analyst manages data integrity and identifies trends through the creation of standard and ad hoc reports as well as developing concepts for tracking performance improvement programs and performance measurements. This position develops and maintains business intelligence systems. The position supports the Authority’s databases and works with a variety of staff and departments to maintain data. The position also must be comfortable with learning and using websites and programs that collect, store, and summarize data that are CATA-exclusive products (e.g. Avail, GenFare, Ecolane, etc.). A bachelor’s degree and/or three years of experience as a data analyst is preferred.
Some pertinent responsibilities of the position are listed below.
Develop and implement databases, data analysis, data mining, data collection systems, and other strategies to optimize efficiency and quality utilizing Excel and other software or programming languages. Familiarity with SQL and Access may be helpful.
Identify, collect, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns across the business in complex data sets and present findings to management by organizing and transforming information into comprehensible structures.
Identify and recommend process changes to enhance efficiency, clarity, and decision-making balanced against current and projected costs.
Develops and maintains data for performance and general systems, reporting to all departments, the CATA Board, and external partners at the local, state, and federal levels.
Performs routine data reporting, ad hoc data analysis, and model data to determine root cause and/or project what-if scenarios.
Maintains scripts for importing or exporting data, nightly backups, and performance monitoring
Supports organization decision-making through effective communication of trends, reports, and summaries, both orally and in formal reporting, presentations, or memorandums.
Assists in the generation of annual service plan documents, supporting both the Transportation Planner and Transportation Coordinator.
Supports departmental managers in the identification of key performance metrics.
Performs related tasks as required.
Completes regular updates to standard operating procedures (SOP) documentation for this position.
Benefits
For this position CATA offers vacation leave, sick leave and nine paid holidays. Health Insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(a), 457, Roth IRA, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Account, Life Insurance, Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), free membership to health club, and free transit pass. CATA employees are eligible for Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF).
Starting salary $56,772; negotiable dependent upon experience and qualifications
Selected candidate will be subject to MVR check, drug and alcohol testing, and criminal background check.
CATA is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business needs.

Company Description

Digitas is the Networked Experience Agency, built on the vision that we create magnetic experiences that earn the right for brands to exist in human networks. Today, and tomorrow. We deliver Networked Experiences by leveraging comprehensive data, technology, creative, media and strategy capabilities. Digitas delivers ambitious outcomes via unique solutions that include Creative Experiences, Integrated Media, Addressable Relationships, Social Marketing and Total Commerce. Celebrated by Ad Age as Data and Insights Agency of the Year, U.S Campaign’s Brand Experience Agency of the Year, Media Network of the Year and celebrated by Forrester and Gartner, Digitas serves the world’s leading brands through a global network comprised of more than 5,500 employees across over 65 offices in 43 countries.

Job Description

The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients.
To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Senior Analyst – someone who can analyze massive data sets, make insightful cross-channel recommendations, and communicate strategic ideas to clients. Sound like you? Read on.
Job Responsibilities:
As a Senior Analyst, you’ll build the strategic and tactical foundation for data-driven marketing efforts. You’ll work to achieve client goals through brand and acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.
Day-to-day, your role includes:
Instituting frameworks across project and campaign lifecycles, including measurement plans, primary and secondary research, and performance reporting
Diving into large data sets, uncovering insights, and providing impactful recommendations to clients
Connecting the dots across channels through data (including display media, site, search, email, and social) to provide a holistic view of marketing efforts
Communicating with clients regularly on scheduled deliverables and ad-hoc requests
Collaborating with internal teams and external partners to drive success for client’s business goals

Qualifications

We’re looking for strong, impactful work experience, which typically includes:
3-5 years of experience in analytics or strategy
Passion for digital marketing and emerging trends in the digital landscape
Experience communicating with internal and external stakeholders at a variety of levels
Fluency with Excel (including pivot tables and vlookups) and/or other data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau
Comfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment

Additional Information

The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include:
Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance

Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual Sick Days, Volunteer Days, Holiday and Identity days, and more
Matching Gifts programs
Flexible working arrangements
‘Work Your World’ Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for up to 6 weeks a year (based upon eligibility)
Business Resource Groups that support multiple affinities and alliances

At the MBTA, we envision a thriving region enabled by a best-in-class transit system. Our mission is to serve the public by providing safe, reliable, and accessible transportation. MBTA’s core values are built around safety, service, equity, and sustainability and each employee that works for the MBTA performs their roles based on our vision, mission, and values. This includes attendance, participation, and contribution in local safety committee meetings as needed.
Job Summary
The MBTA People Analytics team’s vision is a proactive, data-driven, and strategically integrated MBTA Workforce team, equipped to advance the Authority’s mission and robustly support its workforce. The HR Data Analyst will be a critical member of the team, performing analysis and reporting that is flexible and scalable as the team grows. They will help develop foundational processes that enable the Workforce team to move fast and make quality decisions, resolving high-priority issues rapidly and effectively. The Analyst will be skilled at translating between data-driven, quantitative findings and the complex systems the data represent. They must have familiarity with basic HR concepts, exceptional customer service skills, and an eye for details.
Duties & Responsibilities
Create, maintain, and distribute reporting on hiring, retention, internal employee movement, and other workforce topics.
Support in the maintenance and application of comprehensive workforce assessment model and hiring plan.
Communicate effectively with MBTA internal stakeholders of all levels as a representative of the People Analytics and Workforce teams.

Excellent communication skills that can flow across a wide range of partners, including experience preparing materials for, or presenting to, a leadership audience.

High levels of responsibility working with sensitive information
An interest in Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

DHL Global Forwarding (DGF) is the world leader in air freight services and one of the leading providers of ocean freight services. They also include special transport-related services.

We have an exciting opportunity for an Airfreight Data Analyst to perform data analysis, reporting, for a large strategic within the Airfreight Gateway operations. The Data Analyst monitors a variety of key performance indicators. In addition, the analyst will performs and coordinates assigned duties to help providing solutions that will meet or exceed the requirements of internal/external customers. This position will be based at the customer location in Miami, FL.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure high quality of data and information, including close collaboration with visibility solutions and providers to achieve uninterrupted data inflows and outflows

Drive, adopt and enforce best practices in reporting tools, thereby instilling standard reporting suites for use by the Airfreight team in weekly/monthly/quarterly/annual reviews
Manage data needs of the Airfreight team and customer including data collection, analysis, high-quality reporting, and strategic data-based continuous improvement recommendations
Respond to time-critical ad hoc requests and participate in report design, administration, maintenance, fine-tuning, and data reconciliation
Prepare accurate and meaningful qualitative and quantitative reports, analyses and briefs for various internal and external stakeholders

Provide solutions / analytical support for implementation of strategic projects as assigned to the Airfreight team.

SKILLS / QUALIFICATION
Working knowledge of DHL’s business applications, standard Microsoft software (particularly Excel), and business processes including third party and in-house developed applications
Excellent analytical skills, with attention to detail and a focus on accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of deliverables

Ability to identify and resolve problematic areas and trends in data
Ability to develop graphs, reports, and presentations
Ability to work as effectively independently as with a team
Ability to strictly adhere to deadlines

Minimum 2-3 years of experience in data management
Excellent interpersonal and verbal / written communications skills, including strong follow through capabilities

About DHL Global Forwarding (DGF):

DHL Global Forwarding (DGF) is the world leader in air freight services and one of the leading providers of ocean freight services. Around 30,000 employees work to ensure the transport of all kinds of shipments by air or sea. DGF's logistics solutions span the entire supply chain, from the factory to the shop floor. Our business model is very asset-light, as it is based on the brokerage of transport services between customers and freight carriers. Bilingual skills

Data Analyst
We are seeking a dedicated and skilled Data Analyst to join our NYC-based team. In this role, you will be instrumental in extracting and interpreting data from our platform, revealing actionable insights for marketing strategies, enhancing team-wide understanding of our data.

About Us
Located in the vibrant heart of New York City, Fairing stands at the forefront of a data revolution. Our mission? To turn the tide in how brands interact with direct-from-consumer data. We're not just about collecting data; we're about uncovering the stories and secrets hidden within it. At Fairing, curiosity fuels our journey as we empower brands to forge deeper, direct relationships with their customers.
Our team of 15 is a powerhouse of creativity and inquisitive minds. We're backed by a network of visionary investors and advisors who share our excitement for discovery. If you're driven by a desire to explore uncharted territories in data and make a tangible impact, Fairing is your launchpad. Join us and let's unravel the mysteries of data together.

Responsibilities
We are seeking a dedicated and skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in extracting and interpreting data to derive actionable insights for marketing purposes and enhancing team-wide understanding of our extensive data resources.
Data Analysis: Analyze extensive datasets to uncover insights, identifying trends and patterns crucial for shaping marketing strategies and business decisions.
Team Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to understand and fulfill their data needs, translating complex information into actionable insights.
System Development: Develop and refine data systems and processes, focusing on efficiency and data quality to support analytics goals.
Data Visualization: Craft clear, interactive visualizations from diverse data sources, making complex information accessible and engaging for various audiences.
Data Integrity: Maintain high standards of data accuracy and integrity, ensuring reliable and meaningful analysis.
Continuous Learning: Keep up-to-date with the latest trends and tools in data analytics, fostering ongoing professional development.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient in SQL and experience with other analytical tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience in data visualization and storytelling.
Ability to work independently as a do-er, with a hands-on approach to data analysis.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

High school or equivalent diploma
Work a flexible schedule/shift/work area, including weekends, nights, and/or holidays
Can lift up to 49 pounds, stand/walk during shifts lasting up to 12 hours, and be able to frequently push, pull, squat, bend, and reach
Work 40 hours/week, and overtime as required
Programming experience in Excel VBA and Pythin

We continue to grow and today are looking for a committed, talented, star to join our team as our US Data & Reporting Analyst.

This includes focusing on critical strategic accounts linked with Riverside’s branded products, notably MadeGood®. Live and uphold the Company’s Values

Act as the US Master Data liaison for Material, Customer, Vendor, and SAP Pricing Setup.

Collaborate extensively with Marketing, Sales, Category, and Supply Chain teams to enhance reporting capabilities.
Hold a pivotal role as the Key Decision Maker for Reference Table Coding Maintenance across various data sources.
Provide support to Cross Functional Teams by generating reports on Velocity, Distribution, Pricing, Shelving, and other essential performance indicators.
Work closely with the Sales Strategy & Planning Team (Sales Analytics, Sales Planning, & Category Management) to streamline reporting sources, ensuring simplified access to data for the team.
Assist in utilizing ETL Tools (Tableau Prep, Alteyx) to transform raw data into actionable databases for the broader US Team & Leadership. Work as a TEAM player to support the Sales team during the Annual Planning process.
Take OWNERSHIP and identify market trends and areas of opportunity to share out with Sales team
Keeps the work atmosphere FUN by keeping it light and welcoming.
Reporting Relationships
The Data & Reporting Analyst reports to the US Sales Analytics Manager.
Education & Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree
1-2+ years of work experience in field
Experience working with cross-functional teams and ability to work on several deliverables simultaneous.
MS Excel advanced level and ability to create confidently draw conclusions from data.

Skills & Abilities
Solid Communication abilities - both written and verbal
Strong Attention to Detail, and Ability to Make Decisions Quickly.
Competency in Microsoft applications, SAP and Tableau
Intermediate knowledge of data analytics and BI tools
Self-starter
Ability to work independently, anticipate and react to frequently changing business conditions with proven ability to perform under tight deadlines.
Open to change, quick learning agility
Adept and Agile in working through business analytics.
Energy, PASSION, ambition, competitiveness

Role: Global Financial Data Analyst
Team: Global Merchandise Finance & Planning
Scope: Individual Contributor, P4
Years of Experience: 7+ Years
Location: Ventura, CA
COVID-19 Vaccinations: Patagonia requires all employees to demonstrate proof of receiving a COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of their employment.

The position plays a key role partnering with the Senior Director of Global Merch Finance & Line Planning and the VP of Global Integrated Business Planning (IBP) in running complex analyses to help inform business decisions and supporting the on-going global rollout of the new integrated business planning process.
This role is expected to be able to work independently to identify the data and specific approach required to answer complex business questions. They will work extensively with cross-functional global, regional, and corporate finance and planning team members and are expected to be able to independently drive analyses to their logical conclusion. They will derive key insights and advocate for specific actions required to craft an efficient Global Integrated Business Planning Process.
The position plays a lead role in ensuring on-going data integrity for the Global Planning team and establishing standards for regular global reporting. They will be responsible for prioritizing reporting requests from a multitude of stakeholders, including Business Units (BU) and Product Finance. They will also determine the best formats and data points to create standardized reporting views that speak to the needs of those groups. Critical thinking will be a key attribute for validating data accuracy in TM1 models and troubleshooting data issues independently.
They will propose and complete special projects and be a key driver in the rollout of the Global IBP process. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a keen understanding of the role data plays in driving Global IBP strategy and informing business decisions.
What You’ll Do
Global Integrated Business Planning Process
Consult with BUs and Product Finance to determine pre-season & in-season data/reporting needs and the most impactful ways to deliver the requested information and insights. Evaluate and recommend priorities for action to the Global Merch Finance & Planning Lead.
Independently drive requested analyses to inform critical business decisions
Drive creation of monthly reporting and analysis required to inform monthly global S&OP process. Facilitate monthly global S&OP process by building inventory analysis reports for Global Merch Finance & Planning Lead. Make recommendations and enhancements related to on-going inventory analysis and management.
From on-going seasonal consultations, build a library of standardized and self-service reporting views that fulfill existing BU reporting needs and anticipate future requirements.
Validate data accuracy in TM1 models, SnowFlake database & troubleshoot data issues.
Manage the Global Integrated Business Planning Calendar; proactively addressing any issues/conflicts which may cause delays, ensuring calendar remains accurate and up-to-date.
Take on special projects, make recommendations, and build buy-in related to the Global IBP process rollout, including on-going global change management communication, IBP training materials development, leading global IBP training sessions, and follow-ups on data submission deadlines.
Key Deliverables
Validated data to inform Global Financial Plans and Models
Library of standardized reports to inform BU leads and Global team
Monthly Global S&OP preparation
Accurate Global Integrated Planning Calendar
Ad-hoc analyses (as requested)
Ownership of special projects
Who You Are
Accurate: impeccable attention to detail and completely comfortable checking your own work
Effective Communicator – ability to consistently communicate, accurately relay pertinent information to others, and follow up between external and internal parties
Nimble – able to handle multiple tasks and meet required deadlines
Proactive & Prescient – Anticipate an opportunity, question, or answer before it happens….and get after it without being told.
Confident: you prioritize well; you’re comfortable forming and sharing opinions
Dynamic: you bring enthusiasm and passion for our work of saving our home planet
Resilient: you’re tolerant of ambiguity and happy working in an evolving environment
Experience You Bring
7+ years of data management, financial analysis and reporting experience (preferably within a planning or finance environment in the retail consumer products sector)
College degree in a related field, Commerce or Business Administration
Exceptional analytical and modelling skills with experience in data consolidation and reporting
Proficiency in data validation and troubleshooting techniques is necessary to ensure data accuracy
Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize multiple requests are important in managing data integrity and supporting reporting needs.
Effective communication and collaboration skills are also necessary for working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge of financial planning systems, such as TM1, is valuable
Expert knowledge of Excel is required with a proficiency in Tableau and PowerPoint
Hiring Range: $115,00 to $125,000
Pay Range: $100,320 to $150,480

Description
At Truepill, we power the future of consumer healthcare. We started in 2016 with a vision to modernize healthcare. We provide the building blocks needed to launch and scale world-class healthcare experiences.
With over 10 million prescriptions shipped and millions of patients served, we work with many of the world’s largest healthcare organizations - including payers, providers, life sciences companies, consumer health brands, and government agencies. And with new partners continually joining our mission, we aim to further shape the future of healthcare - one patient at a time. Come join us. Let’s build something great together.

We’re looking for an experienced Data Analyst to support our Engineering and Data team. You’ll work alongside collaborative partners and dedicated achievers in the field to help support our mission. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve Truepill’s biggest challenges through insights and prototyping ML solutions.

Why You'll Love Working at Truepill...

We are collaborators – The backbone of Truepill is our people. We support each other by listening and evolving together to make our goals attainable.
We are curious – We never settle for how it’s done today. We invent how it will be done tomorrow. Because we don’t just ask “why?”, we ask “why not?”.
We are innovators – We’re the spark that ignites positive change in healthcare. We create impact because we don’t anticipate; we innovate.
We are honest – Leading with integrity is the foundation of trust. We always do what’s best for our people, our customers, and above all, our patients.
We are committed to supporting employees’ happiness, health, and overall well-being - We offer a variety of PTO plans and comprehensive benefits for both our remote and onsite employees.
You're excited about this opportunity because...
You will define, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve our fulfillment operations and product experience through ML models and applications
You will drive ML-modeling roadmaps through your insights and recommendations
You will curate and label data to be consumed by automated processes
You will collaborate with operations, product managers, solution architects, other engineering teams and support for productization of software services and features
You will define, document, and manage requirements through interacting with software developers, technical architects, and various teams and leaders within Truepill
You will scrub, validate, and develop databases or master data
You will partner across teams on a wide array of products and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Operations, Product, Engineering, Data Engineering, Finance and others.
We're excited about you because...
You have 2-3 years of experience using SQL, R, and Python
You possess a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Information Systems, Supply Chain, or other related degree
You have intermediate experience working with relational databases and query tools
You are able to provide coherent data analysis through clear and concise dashboards
You have exceptional quantitative abilities and problem solving skills
You have a strong attention to detail and process follow through
You are able to work independently and cross functionally
You possess great organizational, interpersonal and customer service skills; you are an excellent communicator with active listening skills
You are fluency at an intermediate level with Business Intelligence tools including Tableau, Looker and Data Studio
You have a working knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc)
You are experienced inc resting and documenting detailed requirements, user stories/specification by example, business processes, fit/gap analysis
The salary range for this position is $90,000-$130,000.

About this position:
The Finance & Strategy (F&S) team serves as a trusted adviser to the business to help guide decision-making through business partner support and innovative and insightful analyses. We are looking for forward-thinking, driven individuals that will succeed in a fast-paced environment and thrive in leading teams, and improve processes that will allow the company to scale with growth!

The F&S Data team is seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented professional to join our team. In this role, you will play a critical role in supporting the team’s end to end monthly data refresh process and maintaining robust process governance frameworks, policies, and procedures to ensure the integrity, quality, and security of our organization's data assets. The ideal candidate possesses a strong analytical mindset, proficiency in data manipulation and visualization, and a passion for uncovering meaningful trends and patterns within complex datasets. They should also have deep understanding of data management principles, excellent communication skills, and a passion for promoting a culture of data stewardship and accountability. The candidate will also play a vital role in large transformational data projects within Salesforce's finance organization, necessitating a solid understanding of finance operations and their underlying principles. The role would serve as a Data SME to certain F&S functions and is integral to Salesforce's pursuit of excellence in finance, emphasizing both technical capability and a strategic understanding of business processes.
Responsibilities:
Intake business changes to metadata and mapping required in order to achieve business needs.
Able to understand and translate business requirements into effective data mapping solutions. A clear understanding of the business processes and data dependencies is crucial.
Collaborate with partners to define data quality standards and metrics, and establish mechanisms for ongoing monitoring and improvement.
Serve as the Data SME for Customer Success and Corporate Revenue teams and Maintain data mapping files to support these functions.
Play a key role on various, data-related, large-scale transformation projects (e.g. Cloud ERP system transition, chart of accounts consolidation/rationalization, centralizing mapping within CFO organization, etc.)
Analyze large datasets and extract actionable insights. Interpret data trends, patterns, and anomalies to provide valuable business intelligence.
Clean, preprocess, and transform raw data into a usable format. Ensure data quality and accuracy, resolving discrepancies as needed.
Support weekly, monthly and quarterly audit checks to ensure data mapping files are aligned to the Corporate functional targets.
Generate regular and ad-hoc reports to support decision-making processes. Collaborate with partners to understand reporting requirements and deliver insights in a timely manner.
Provide support to develop communication strategies to raise awareness of data governance initiatives within F&S. Deliver training and support to partners to enhance their understanding of data governance principles and practices.
Lead creative ideas for improving current processes; build automations as needed or partner with other technical teams to provide requirements.
Effectively partner with other governing bodies across Salesforce to ensure policies / processes are aligned.
Drive resolution where business requests are in direct violation of our governances / processes.
Familiar with creating visualizations and dashboards to communicate complex data insights to non-technical partners. Use tools like Tableau or others to present information in a clear and accessible manner. Prior knowledge and/or experience with Tableau would be a bonus.
Use MS Excel, Hyperion Essbase, Tableau and other financial systems and tools to locate, extract, manipulate, and analyze data.
Develop an in-depth understanding of the Finance & Strategy (F&S) organization, it’s financial processes, and how it's operations are ultimately reflected in the Chart of Accounts (COA) and Business dimensions.
Minimum Requirements
Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on theValues & Behaviors for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc.)
2-3+ years work experience in FP&A, Accounting, Consulting, Operations, or Data preferably at a public company with experience in data analytics, curation and validation
Ability to manage multiple projects and processes in a fast paced, dynamic environment with competing priorities
Experience with multi-dimensional databases, e.g. Hyperion, Workday or other financial systems
Medium to advanced skills in Excel
Stellar problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with different levels of management, business partners, and technical communities
Highly motivated, proactive, self-aware, collaborative, flexible, responsive, positive and fun
Nice to Have Skills/Experience:
Proven process-improvement track record
Experience with reporting and analytics applications is a plus, e.g. Business Objects, Tableau, Salesforce Analytics
Experience and comfort with data analysis languages e.g. SQL, Python, R is a plus

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

FUNCTION: The Data Analyst analyzes data including, but not limited to, historical financial information, publicly available data, and customer/transactional data to predict future results and drive process and policy improvements. Further, this position will work with the Director, Accounting and Data Analysis, to present findings to executive leaders and develop reports to help devise strategies that will drive the execution of strategic business goals and support a data driven culture.
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
Assists executive leadership in the development and reporting of Corporate Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and other strategic initiative reporting.
Implements data standards and deploys automation tools to extract, synthesize, and validate data from different sources and transform data into usable metrics.
Gathers and cleans data by removing errors, identifying outliers, and transforming data into a format that can be analyzed.
Analyzes and explores data for insights usings statistical methods to identify trends and make predictions.
Presents the results of data analysis projects to executive leadership.
Constructs data sets, monitors data quality, troubleshoots and resolves database issues to ensure data integrity.
Utilizes scripting and querying tools like SQL, data visualization/BI tools, statistical methods, and data modeling to produce reports, data files, and dashboards.
Collaborates with stakeholders and executive leadership to understand their needs, objectives, and requirements.
Facilitates ad-hoc reporting and/or analysis requests from executive leaders related to progress on strategic priorities.
Assures the integrity of financial and statistical data, reports, schedules, worksheets, or other analysis.
Assumes additional responsibilities as needed or assigned.
SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:
Experience or ability to compile and present data in a concise and impactful way to effect change.
Exhibits logical problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Effective communication skills including excellent listening skills and the ability to present data to employees at all levels of the organization in an effective manner.
Understands business implications of decisions and displays understanding of top and bottom-line drivers.
Highly motivated and a self-starter with the ability to conceptualize and apply new solutions.
Strong ability to learn new systems and utilize them to properly analyze data.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities at the same time.
Proficiency with Microsoft applications with advanced experience in Microsoft Excel; Power BI and SQL experience preferred.
MINIMUM LEVEL OF PREPARATION AND TRAINING NORMALLY REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree in math, accounting, statistics, or related field or equivalent experience.
APPLICATION PROCESS:
You can directly apply through Cass's website at https://www.cassinfo.com/careers. Please apply directly to this position via the “Apply” button. You will be required to create an account and provide your resume, contact information and other pertinent employment information. This process typically takes 20 minutes or less. Should we find that you meet the minimum requirement of the position, a member of our recruiting team will be in touch to start the interview process.
ABOUT OUR COMPANY:
Cass Information Systems, Inc. is a leading provider of integrated information and payment management solutions. Cass enables enterprises to achieve visibility, control and efficiency in their supply chains, communications networks, facilities and other operations. Disbursing over $90 billion annually on behalf of clients, and with total assets in excess of $2.5 billion, Cass is uniquely supported by Cass Commercial Bank. Founded in 1906 and a wholly owned subsidiary, Cass Commercial Bank provides sophisticated financial exchange services to the parent organization and its clients. Cass is part of the Russell 2000®. More information is available at www.cassinfo.com.

Description:

The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of data analysis principles, proficiency in SQL and Python, and the ability to extract meaningful insights from consumer data. The selected candidate will play a crucial role in developing prospect targeting lists and driving data-driven marketing initiatives.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Experience with machine learning and data mining techniques
Experience with CRM systems and marketing automation platforms
Experience in developing predictive models and forecasting
Experience with market segmentation techniques
