Do you want to build Cyber capabilities and capacity to enable national security operations? Do you want to be at the forefront of Cyber defense, tackling a complex mission to protect against the threats of today and tomorrow? If so, NSA is the place for you! Cryptographic Vulnerability Analysts play a critical role in enabling security solutions by: - identifying vulnerabilities of and attacks to cryptographic systems - comparing and contrasting various cryptographic attack techniques - producing formal and informal reports, briefings and perspectives - analyzing data using mathematical/statistical methods - conducting security evaluations - developing countermeasures to address cryptographic vulnerabilities - designing, evaluating or modifying encryption schemes or algorithm The ideal candidate is someone with strong problem-solving, analytic, communication and interpersonal skills who is/can: - motivated - flexible - innovative - work effectively across in diverse environments - well-organized - handle multiple assignments
Job Summary
Are you a cyber professional with the drive and expertise to be on the forefront of the cyber fight; tackling NSA's complex mission to defend against cyber threats of today and tomorrow? NSA, the nation's leading cyber agency, has exciting and challenging positions in Cyber Security Engineering and Cyber and TEMPEST vulnerability analysis/mitigation. Are you ready to help secure our Nation's critical Infrastructure? If so, NSA is the place for you!
Qualifications
The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Degree must be in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or any degree that includes at least 2 years (i.e., 24 credit hours) of advanced mathematics. Relevant experience must include at least one of the following: design, development, use and evaluation of mathematics models, methods, or techniques (e.g., cryptographic algorithms) to study issues and solve problems; vulnerability analysis, penetration testing, or computer forensics. In addition, experience may include information/cyber/network security and/or information assurance. Completion of military training in a relevant area such as JCAC (Joint Cyber Analysis course), Undergraduate Cyber Training (UCT), Network Warfare Bridge Course (NWBC)/Intermediate Network Warfare Training (INWT), Cyber Defense Operations will be considered towards the relevant experience requirement (i.e., 20-24 weeks course will count as 6 months of experience, 10-14 weeks will count as 3 months of experience). ENTRY/DEVELOPMENTAL Entry is with a Bachelor's degree and no experience. An Associate's degree plus 2 years of relevant experience may be considered for individuals with in-depth experience that is clearly related to the position. FULL PERFORMANCE Entry is with a Bachelor's degree plus 3 years of relevant experience, or a Master's degree plus 1 year of relevant experience, or a Doctoral degree and no experience. An Associate's degree plus 5 years of relevant experience may be considered for individuals with in-depth experience that is clearly related to the position.
Competencies
- Analyze problems to determine technical solutions. - Decide what procedures will be required to solve technical problems. - Evaluate technical proposals. - Identify new applications of known techniques. - Analyze data using mathematical/statistical methods. - Analyze new algorithms and protocols. - Evaluate solution designs. - Apply mathematical or computational methods and lines of reasoning. - Create and maintain documentation on technical information. - Document research processes, analyses and/or the results. - Write logical and accurate technical reports to communicate ideas across the enterprise. - Ensure secure transmission by designing, evaluating, or modifying encryption schemes or algorithms. - Conduct security evaluations of hardware or software components or architectures. - Evaluate methods, tools, and techniques that can be used to secure information/communication systems and the facilities that house them. - Develop mitigation strategies and countermeasures to address vulnerabilities of networks, products, and services.
Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule
Pay: Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position. Salary Range: $81,233 - $142,341 (Entry/Developmental, Full Performance) Salary range varies by location, work level, and relevant experience to the position. On the job training, internal NSA courses, and external training will be made available based on the need and experience of the selectee. Benefits: NSA offers excellent benefits to include relocation assistance, flexible work schedules, generous leave programs, paid personal fitness time, training and continuing education classes, health and life insurance, Federal Thrift Savings Plan (TSP), and a Federal retirement plan. Work Schedule: This is a full-time position, Monday - Friday, with basic 8hr/day work requirement between 6:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. (flexible).
How to apply
Apply soonest, as job postings can close earlier than stated end dates due to changes in requirements. It is important to review and note the minimum qualifications, as only those applicants who meet the required qualifications will be contacted to continue the employment process. Please populate the resume tool to showcase any relevant work experience and education related to the position and answer any applicable screening questions. Information collected will be used to determine eligibility, and failure to provide accurate information may result in disqualification for this position. A confirmation email will be sent after submission of the first application and also after any future updates to submitted applications. **Due to time sensitive communications regarding applications, please ensure your spam filters are configured to accept email from noreply@intelligencecareers.gov. For job vacancies that include stated testing requirements, also include the following: @uwe.nsa.gov, @nsa.gov, and @pearson.com** U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. NSA is also committed to the promotion of diversity within its workforce. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph. Reasonable accommodations may be provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. Please visit our Diversity link for more information https://www.intelligencecareers.gov/NSA/diversity-and-inclusion.
DCIPS Disclaimer
The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

What do we expect from Data Analyst?
Having enough raw data will not help the business reach their goals but making sense with data is .Data Analysts do more than merely presenting numbers and figures to management. They take more in-depth approach to recording, analyzing raw data for insights and trends , obstructing meaningful information , and presenting the findings in an easy format.

The responsibilities of a data analyst often include:
Designing and maintaining data systems and databases, including troubleshooting potential issues
Mining and cleaning data in preparation for analysis
Source and query data required for both ongoing business intelligence efforts and larger-scale data science projects.
Draw meaningful insights from large datasets
Support daily reporting on core business functions.
Use visualization tools to present complex data in a simple, engaging manner.
Assist in the management of long-term data projects. Effectively communicate with business stakeholders.
Identify opportunities for new data projects. Ask smart questions, diagnose the real problem, and develop a long-term solution.
Preparing reports which effectively communicate their findings to organizational leadership and key stakeholders
Required qualifications
The candidate must have a strong background in computer science, engineering, mathematics

Technical experience that involves querying and manipulating data to address business problems
MySQL and SQL Server: proficient with complex queries
MS Excel: advanced proficiency (Pivot Tables, Pivot Charts, AutoFilter, Macro, VBA, and Advanced Formulas
MS Access: proficient with loading data, writing queries and manipulating data
Power BI
Experience in common analytics tools (SQL, Tableau, Adobe/Google Analytics)
Knowledge of coding languages (i.e. R, Python)
data visualization and presentation skills,
Interest in more advanced topics in analytics (machine learning, artificial intelligence)

Need a Data Analyst or Data Scrubber. Hybrid to sit onsite in their East Greenville, PA office 3 times/week. Contract to hire so need a GC Holder or Citizen Rate is 58.00/hr.C2C We have major issues with incorrect work order data (BOM’s, etc). Looking to see if we could create a “data scrubber” that would be able to create and run a report that would identify data incorrectness before the work order hits the production floor (then it is very painful as it results in us making the product incorrectly). I’d say this would be a step above data analyst - perhaps a date engineer This person would be the one creating the “scrubber” – it would involve first a significant time investment to learn the product so an effective scrubber can be created. We have knowledgeable support staff here who could help the person gain that knowledge. I need the person to: • Gain the knowledge (of what good/bad data looks like) • Create the scrubber • Create reports from the scrubber that we can send to the database group with the scrubbed/clean data I see this is a multiple month assignment at minimum. This is a great need here, so if we get the right person, I can see permanent opportunities for the person. He/she could really make a mark. Initially, for the learning, I’d strongly recommend being on-site as there will be value in seeing the product. As the project progresses, can probably do more from home (though I’m more of a fan of work from work vs. WFH). • The data resides in JDE (JD Edwards) – so they’d need to be or get proficient in that…then use whatever program necessary to create the scrubber and reports • Salary negotiable

Description:
The Data Analyst (Business Intelligence) will join our National Security Innovation Network (NSIN) project and will have the opportunity to serve their country by embedding with key decision makers at the top levels of the U.S. Government. This role will join a team already recognized for its standout business analytics. The Data Analyst will be responsible for the success of internal business operations and the decisions made to meet Government goals, all to drive for greater efficiency and accuracy of executing the mission. This will require the Data Analyst to build insightful reports, research ventures and innovators across the US, and present their products to Government Leadership - all while embodying high standards of Eccalon professionalism.

Responsibilities:
Utilize NSIN's data and information about innovation in the US for use in analyzing trends and patterns around technology investments
Generate monthly reports on how well NSIN components and the overall enterprise are working based on agency KPIs
Provide 1:1 assistance to the rest of the workforce regarding how to enter their reporting and how to utilize the data for their own products
Track and respond to ad hoc product requests from leaders across the agency in a timely and polite manner
Use data profiling and other discovery techniques to locate anomalies, outliers, and other instances that would cause a bottleneck in business operations
Design and execute models for improved data collection, continually pivoting as needed to support the business
Interpret key datasets to recommend process improvement opportunities
Support the team in maintaining and supporting several activities, including inputting and cleaning data, researching data conversions, establishing data specifications, updating sources, and ensuring data integrity
Mine data for the purposes of experimenting predictive model prototypes
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Math, Operations Research, Statistics, Data Analytics, or similar analytic-heavy programs - OR equivalent experience in Data Analytics
At least 1-2 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Business Analytics, Statistics, Data Analysis, or other related jobs
Experience writing advanced MS Excel and Google Sheet formulas, creating pivot tables, and other queries
Aptitude to quickly learn and apply unfamiliar models and analysis techniques. To continually improve available technical skillsets.
Demonstrated ability to query information and visually present trends, patterns, and anomalies
Ability to work as a team and independently
Excellent technical writing skills, including the ability to communicate analytic results to other business departments at all organization levels
Ability to pass a background check, including, but not limited to, personal and professional financial history, nationwide criminal record search, credit check and other relevant background information deemed necessary by Eccalon
Ability to obtain and maintain a United States passport
Ability to pass a pre-employment drug screen

Desired Qualifications:
Ability to work in SQL, Python, R, and/or Javascript languages
Knowledge of building visualizations in any of the following: Tableau, Kibana, R Shiny, R Studio, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, D3.js, or other equivalent tools
Knowledge of mapping networks and geospatial locations

Physical Requirements: The ability to focus on computer screens for extensive periods of time.
About NSIN:
NSIN is a U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) organization with the mission to build networks of innovators that generate new solutions to national security problems. NSIN does this by building communities of non-traditional defense problem solvers from the academic and venture communities, exposing these communities to national security problems through direct interaction with DoD end users, and supporting the further development and transition of these solutions into the DoD. The principal way in which NSIN achieves its mission is through three mutually supporting portfolios of programs: National Service, Collaboration, and Acceleration. NSIN's Regional Network Team will be physically located in more than 35 different locations throughout the United States and is responsible for building the new communities of problem-solvers through which NSIN executes its programs. To learn more, visit our website here www.nsin.us.

Job Summary:
Under the general direction of the Manager, Data or assigned designee, and in accordance with good business practices and established procedures, the Data Visualization Analyst is responsible for translating complex data into insightful and actionable visualizations that enable data-driven decision-making. The role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design effective visual representations, facilitate the design of effective visual representations through other DIS team members, create interactive dashboards and reports. The ideal candidate will have a strong blend of analytical, design, and technical skills to create compelling data visualizations that enhance operational efficiency and performance across the organization.
Position may require travel to Infinite Legacy regional offices.
Education/Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Information Technology, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field plus 5 years experience or Master’s degree plus 3 years experience.
Proven experience (3+ years) in designing and developing data visualizations and interactive dashboards within the workforce utilizing PowerBI.
Proficiency (3+ years) in data visualization tools within the workforce, like Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from complex datasets.
Solid understanding of data visualization principles, including data aggregation, visualization types, and color theory.
Proficiency in working with SQL (3+ years) for data extraction and manipulation.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R is advantageous.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate technical findings into non-technical language.
Attention to detail and a passion for creating clear and compelling visualizations.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Duties/Responsibilities:
Data Analysis and Interpretation:
Collect and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights relevant to operational and performance metrics.
Work closely with subject matter experts to understand data requirements and translate them into meaningful visualizations.
Data Visualization Design:
Design and develop interactive and static visualizations (charts, graphs, maps, etc.) that effectively communicate complex information to various stakeholders.
Utilize best practices in data visualization to ensure clarity, accuracy, and aesthetic appeal in the visual representations.
Dashboard Development:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements for dashboards and reports, understanding their needs for monitoring and decision-making.
Build interactive dashboards using data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to provide real-time insights and key performance indicators.
Oversee the building of reports from other team members to weigh in with best practices for visualization and reporting.
Collaboration and Communication:
Work closely with cross-functional teams including data analysts, business analysts, and managers to align data visualization solutions with business goals.
Present complex findings and insights in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Create and maintain report deployment based on best practices.
Continuous Improvement:
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging data visualization tools and techniques.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, data collection, and data presentation methods.
Quality Assurance:
Validate the accuracy of data visualizations and ensure consistency with underlying data sources.
Conduct thorough testing of dashboards to ensure functionality and performance.
Application Process:
Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their resume and portfolio showcasing previous data visualization projects. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview to further assess their qualifications and fit for the role.
Working Conditions:
This position requires consistent availability, travel, and certain physical, language, and communication abilities, including:
Manual dexterity sufficient to operate telephones and computers.
Vision correctable to 20/20 to read electronic medical charts and computer screens. Frequent and prolonged use of computer screen may produce visual fatigue.
Possible mental fatigue and stress associated with emergencies and management issues.
Ability to accurately communicate, converse, and exchange information in English over the telephone and in person.
Sitting for extended periods of time.
Frequent prolonged use of computer screen may produce visual fatigue.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, and other devices and objects.
Computer literacy in a Microsoft Windows environment and demonstrated competency in the use of Microsoft Office software programs.
Works in normal office environment where there are no physical discomforts due to temperatures, noise, dust, etc.
Work requires attention to detail, flexibility in assignment changes, and meeting deadlines that may produce mental fatigue.
This is a level 3 Blood-borne Pathogen Exposure position. Employees have low to no exposure to Blood-borne Pathogens and no exposure to TB. Employees do not visit hospitals.
The employer retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position. The employee must be able to perform the essential functions of the position satisfactorily and, if requested, reasonable accommodations will be made to enable employees with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job, absent undue hardship.
The above is intended to describe the general content and requirements of the job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements.

The Upper Valley Haven provides temporary shelter, supportive housing, food, and problem solving to those in need. We provide services without cost or judgement and practice respect and kindness to all. At the Haven, we invest in our team by providing outstanding benefits, cultivating a culture focused on their well-being and personal and professional growth, and offering opportunities to be involved in shaping the organization.

Overview
We are seeking an experienced data analyst to ensure the quality of our program data and produce reports for internal and external stakeholders. The ideal candidate is able to provide data management support to our busy staff with patience and compassion. They love working with data and developing dashboards and infographics to communicate our metrics and outcomes to staff and board members. They continuously look for ways to streamline our data processes and leverage our data.

Benefits
Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, paid holidays, generous paid time off, life insurance, and a matching 403(b) retirement plan. We invest in the growth and development of our staff with a role-based, funded learning and development plan. Staff are encouraged to participate in staff-led committees to identify and advance organizational initiatives. We are also a dog-friendly workplace.

Compensation
This is a 32 hour/week position with some flexibility for the right candidate. The salary range is $23 to $28/hour depending on education, training, and/or experience.

Requirements
Critical to the success of this position are:
Excellent communication and design skills; ability to convey data in a clear and concise manner
Self-motivated and able to prioritize, meet deadlines and manage changing priorities
Good understanding of and competency in relational databases
Advanced skills in Excel and other Microsoft Office products
Demonstrated talent and ability to learn new technologies and implement them
Experience and knowledge of homelessness and housing, and coordinated entry a plus
Knowledge using Clarity (an HMIS system) a plus
Demonstrate the highest ethical standards and maintains confidentiality
Valid driver's license

Qualified applicants will have a BA/BS in Computer Science, Social Sciences, or Communications.

The Upper Valley Haven is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse workplace environment that is welcoming and safe for all. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We are committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Job Description
Role Overview:
The Data Quality Analyst Lead will be responsible for the processing, curation, and enhancement of priority alternative datasets for the Citadel Securities Research Team. The Lead will focus on understanding datasets deeply, while adding value and improvements through data analysis and pattern recognition. These datasets will then be ingested to enrich alpha signals across our Systematic Trading and Research Business.
The Data Quality Analyst Lead will work closely with many teams across Citadel Securities including Data Engineers, Quantitative Researchers, and Data Strategy, playing an integral role in evaluating and extracting value from the most promising and unique data asset available.
We are looking for individuals that are very detailed-oriented and excited about working with data to find patterns and solve problems!
Location:
New York
Responsibilities:
Run first-pass and basic analysis on datasets, such as Pareto analysis, and basic statistics (mean, variance, etc.)
Manage and implement data quality processes and consistency checks, (e.g., normalization of names, text, fields, etc.)
Understand the basic categories, themes, and key performance insights derived from alternative data
Create dashboards and visualizations to illustrate key findings of your analyses
Conduct business-related research to enrich datasets
Manage and oversee other Data Quality Analysts
Qualifications:
Strong attention to detail with a passion for data
Expertise across Data Analysis
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new technologies and skills
Drive for continuous improvements on a data sphere
Experience working in Tableau or another similar BI tool
Familiarity with SQL databases
Managerial experience with strong leadership abilities preferred
Education: BS degree in Business or STEM field
In accordance with New York City’s Pay Transparency Law, the base salary range for this role is $115,000 to $350,000. Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits.
About Citadel Securities
Citadel Securities is the next-generation capital markets firm and a leading global market maker. We provide institutional and retail investors with the liquidity they need to trade a broad array of equity and fixed income products in any market condition. The brightest minds in finance, science and technology use powerful, advanced analytics to solve the market’s most critical challenges, turning big ideas into real-world outcomes.

This person will perform the role of a Data Analyst. The Data Analyst will be responsible for reviewing the data requirements for the Broadband grants and ensuring that the proper data is collected and reported to the granting agency. This Data Analyst will report directly to the Wahzhazhe Connect’s Director and will be responsible for determining the nature and type of data that needs to be collected, the best source for that data, collecting the identified data, analyzing the data, and generating the required reports to be delivered to the proper authorities. This person will also be responsible for verifying the FCC’s fabric map and making any necessary challenges to the FCC.

Highly self-motivated and directed.

Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Ability to facilitate relations between business groups and technology departments.
Experience working independently and, in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential.

Requires a high level of problem-solving skills.

Teamwork makes the stream work.
Roku is changing how the world watches TV
Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the US, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.
From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable - and valued - contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.

About the role
Roku Pay, Core Payments team is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to play an instrumental role in helping Roku take outstanding data tech and turn them into transformative results. You will work closely with analysts, engineers, PMs and business stakeholders to understand business questions, translate them into KPIs, create broad suite of dashboards and reports that allow stakeholders to answer questions quickly and with confidence and also be responsible for uncovering trends and opportunities from such reports The ideal candidate for this role loves designing and building data visualization products and analyzing data that can influence decision making.

What you'll be doing
Strong understanding of experimental design (such as A/B experiments) and experience in running multiple AB Tests
Conduct analyses and opportunity sizing to define addressable markets and operational opportunities for improvement
Monitor key operating metrics, highlighting trends by providing insights into performance against those goals
Continue to build on our advanced analytics around payment authorization performance, AB testing, product engagement, and market-specific performance
Build key dashboards and automated reporting related to key performance metrics
Develop analytical tools (real-time alerts, models, etc.) to combat risk or payment issues
Deliver enhancements to detect anomalies and be able to provide recommendations to improve the authorization strategies
Perform exploratory data analysis on emerging trends and execute advanced analysis across the entire Roku platform
Collaborate with the Payments Product, Operations and Engineering team to proactively seek and incorporate feedback

We're excited if you have
5+ years of work experience with a bachelor's degree or master's degree in quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering or Computer Science)
5+ years of experience across payment, risk, marketplaces, e-commerce, retail, digital media or financial services industries
Expertise in SQL, R, Python or other programming language to query data and perform analysis
Hands on experience with visualization tools like Tableau or Looker
Have a bias towards action in resolving issues and operate in a high-energy, fast-paced environment
Be extremely data driven to solve problems and have a track record of driving results through continuous improvement
Risk analytics/operations, data science/modeling experience or similar quantitative business responsibility for financial or operational performance highly desirable
Hands on A/B testing and statistical modeling/forecasting
#LI-RR1
The Roku Culture
Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We’re independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV.
We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002.
To learn more about Roku, our global footprint, and how we've grown, visit https://www.weareroku.com/factsheet.

The role:
Do you have experience leading projects that are data focused? Apply for our transportation data analyst! In this role, you will work, support and collaborate with managers to help solve complex data analysis issues while documenting the outcomes. You will be exposed to all aspects of data management and have the opportunity to assist with several initiatives that the Transportation Data Section (TDS) is working on! Apply today!
We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for our positions and hope you will join us on our path to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are an agency that embraces social equity through our values, strategic planning, and actions. Leaning into our equity priorities means we continually examine what we do, the impact we have, and our progress toward weaving social equity into who we are. visit our Social Equity website
.

click here
to visit our applicant information website to learn more about our process.

Provide technical coordination and support of transportation engineering (predominately crash, traffic volumes and road inventory) data development, maintenance, production and data analysis to TDS program areas.
Assist in setting standards for databases used by TDS.
Partner with various staff to develop and implement data and visualization solutions.
Develop and maintain computer programs to conduct data analysis for reporting purposes.
Evaluate program operations and services.
Collaborate with managers and program staff to formulate ideas, goals and plans.
Assist management by monitoring and tracking project and operational data.
Create reports, evaluate results, and modifies engineering transportation data to ensure data consistency.
Identify and share potential risks with managers and assist with mitigating them.
Educate internal customers about the appropriate use of engineering transportation data.
Work in an office environment with hybrid remote work options available.

Generic cover letters and/or cover letters that do not address the qualities that you have under the “what we’d like to see” section may receive lower scores than those that addressed the desired qualities.

. The
task to upload your documents

.

We may use this recruitment to fill multiple or future vacancies.
We will conduct name-based criminal background checks on final candidates, including current ODOT employees. All applicants may be subject to additional pre-employment check(s) such as driver license, LEDS (Law Enforcement Data System), and/or education verification as required for the position.

David Weekley Homes is seeking a Lead Data Analyst for a full-time, in office role. This position will play a key role in implementing our data strategy, serving as our company’s technical expert in Reporting & Analytics, while understanding our data's business and IT implications, usage, and significance. You will be instrumental in bridging the gap between data, business, and IT, turning data into actionable business insights.
Responsibilities:
Data Expertise and Standards Implementation:
Develop a comprehensive understanding of how data is utilized across the organization, understanding its impact in various business and IT contexts.
Establish and enforce standards for data usage, presentation, and Power BI report formatting, ensuring consistency and quality across all data-driven initiatives.
Serve as a leading authority on the data's meaning, origins, and applications, providing guidance on best practices in data management and reporting.
Collaborate with the Director of Data Analytics to align the reporting and analytics strategy with the overall business objectives.
Ad-hoc Analysis and Insights:
Conduct targeted ad-hoc data analyses to address specific business challenges.
Translate complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for various departments, adhering to established standards for data presentation.
Effectively communicate analytical findings to a wide range of stakeholders, maintaining high standards in data clarity and accuracy.
Power BI Report Development:
Lead the development and maintenance of Power BI reports and dashboards, following organizational guidelines for report design and data visualization.
Ensure reporting tools are accurate, timely, and aligned with established data standards and best practices.
Participation in Data Solutions Testing:
Collaborate in testing data solutions, including data integrations and data warehouses, ensuring alignment with business, IT requirements, and data standards.
Assist in identifying and resolving data-related issues, maintaining a focus on data quality and adherence to standards.
Stakeholder Engagement:
Work closely with both business and IT units, leveraging your extensive data knowledge to meet their analytical needs.
Provide guidance and support on Power BI tools, data interpretation, and best practices in data reporting.
Continuous Improvement:
Continually enhance data analysis methodologies, reporting processes, and standards.
Stay updated on the latest trends in data analysis, Power BI, and business intelligence.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 7 years of experience performing data analysis.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in Power BI report development, including data modeling, DAX, and Power Query.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and other data analysis tools.
Experience in participating in the testing of data solutions and integrations.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills, able to effectively articulate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated, able to work independently in a dynamic business and IT environment.
Work Location:
This is a full-time position that is required to be on-site. Our office is located in West Houston, near the intersection I-10 Katy Freeway and 610 W Loop N Frwy.
About Us:
David Weekley Homes is an award-winning home builder that has earned spots on FORTUNE® magazine's list of “100 Best Companies to Work For” 17 times! We build homes in 19 markets coast to coast and are the largest privately held builder in America. We have an excellent benefits package, with some unique features including:
Great opportunities to participate in outreach and community involvement programs
Medical, Dental and Vision insurance
Paid Vacation, Holidays and PTO
401(k) with discretionary 8% match
Profit Sharing
Team Member & Family New Home Discount
Team Member Product Discounts
College Scholarship Program
And More!!

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
Global Technology Partners (GTP) serves Salesforce partners who work with us on a technology basis, this includes our ISVs (AppExchange), OEMs, Strategic Partners (AWS, Google etc) and our Alibaba partnership in China.
The GTP team is looking for a Sales Strategy Analyst to join our ISV Strategy and Operations team. Responsibilities would include:
Consolidate multiple data sources to provide ACV, AOV, Attrition and Recruit data sets and dashboards
Design and interpret key sales performance metrics, including sales pipeline, bookings, growth
Support sales leadership with revenue and forecasting insights as needed, including building and maintaining dashboards & other data visualizations
Work with Sales Operations to support performance and compensation audits
Work with Finance Ops and Data Ops teams to audit data accuracy and integrity as needed
Analyze business trends, performance and insights on an ongoing basis
Prepare analysis and recommendations for strategic decision-making
Process any manual compensation calculations and data extractions

The ideal candidate would have:
Experience with data modeling and analytical tools such as Excel, SQL, databases, Python, Tableau SAP Business Objects a plus
A background in data science, analytics or finance.
2+ years of experience in Sales Strategy, Data Analyst, Business Intelligence Analyst or similar roles.
2+ years of relevant business experience
College/university degree or equivalent experience.
Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions
Strong cross-functional collaboration: ability to work with teams that span a wide range of functional areas and communicate effectively across groups that have varying levels of data expertise
Self-starter and high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at hand
Ability to succeed in a collaborative, start-up paced environment
Knowledge of Salesforce products, business systems and processes would be well regarded.

Requisition Title: DATA ANALYST II - PW.3023200 - 23002716
Work Locations: PUBLIC WORKS - 500 ElmST, SUITE 5300 - Dallas
Organization: PUBLIC WORKS
Brief Description
Provides technical support including data/database management, data analysis, maintains the P5 Project Delivery System; serves as departmental liaison to County Information Technology Department; maintains inventory of departmental computer hardware/software, audio/video, and mobile devices; collaborates in the planning, coordination and presentation of audio/video for the S.A.M.E. Infrastructure Forum.
Detailed Description
Collects, maintains and analyzes departmental financial and project-related data for use in a variety of reports/applications; imports, cleans, transforms and/or validates data. Maintains departmental project time-keeping system. Provides and maintains project financial data for MCIP Data App in collaboration with Enterprise GIS. Maintains the P5 system as needed. Provides document management services. Serves as departmental liaison with IT Department for all technology-related issues. Maintains departmental inventory of computer hardware, software, audio/video equipment and mobile devices. Collaborates with external partners in the planning of the annual SA.M.E. Infrastructure Forum. Coordinates and leads audio/video services team for the event. Distributes presentation, collects documents from the event. Performs other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements
Education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or in a job related field of study. One (1) year of professional work related experience in data management and/or data analysis, database management, or activities directly related to the job. Skilled in the use of standard software applications. Understanding data analysis skills. Demonstrated knowledge and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite with focus on Access and Excel. Understand the concepts generating business reports. Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing, and establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, departments and the general public. Knowledge of project management and applications. Standard office environment.
Additional Details
An extensive pre-employment background investigation will be conducted on all applicants who have been offered a position with Dallas County. The hiring process involves successful completion of each step. The steps include: Criminal History Review, Traffic Violations Record, Review of Personal History Statement and Documents, Physical Examination, and Background Investigation. Dallas County is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, National Service Alumni volunteers, and persons with a criminal background are encouraged to apply.

The ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) Data Analyst will serve to support the organizations’ rapidly evolving ESG data reporting requirements. The candidate will serve a key role in leading the ReedHycalog ESG data collection & analysis efforts, driving data-focused campaigns, and interfacing across various functions. This highly collaborative role works with various teams to collect, organize, and evaluate ESG data while maintaining data integrity, supporting database design, and interpreting relevant statistical trends.
PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Manages multiple aspects of the ESG data collection process including setting deadlines, assigning responsibilities, and monitoring, expediting, summarizing, and communicating progress at regular intervals to ensure ReedHycalog meets it annual ESG reporting deadlines.
Identifies and addresses limitations and outliers of ESG data.
Aggregates ESG data as necessary to support sustainability reporting.
Understands our evolving ESG data needs, which current data meets those needs; and recommends complementary data sets.
Analyzes existing data sources and methodologies for accuracy.
Contributes to the development of dashboards to improve ESG process integration where applicable.
Recommends and supports implementation of reporting frameworks and technologies to support regulatory reporting needs.
Ensures that data collection, analysis and reporting projects are completed on time.
Develops and maintains associated documentation and communications.
Gathers, organizes, and interprets data to provide reports and answer questions from management.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Statistics, Mathematics, Accounting, Computer Science, Sustainability / ESG or equivalent work experience required.
Minimum of three (3) years in Data Processing, with at least two years of experience with database management systems.
JDE experience preferred.
Experience in the nuances of specific ESG data sets, data structure and quality of ESG ratings, scores and other data sets is preferred.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Ability to travel between Conroe and Houston NOV office locations.
This position may require travel.
Adhere to all HSE and ESG requirements.
Working hours to be identified by manager.
BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES
Autonomy - Adept at exercising good judgement with limited information, possibly constrained by tight deadlines.
Cooperation - Willing to provide colleagues with relevant information they need to complete their tasks and eliminate roadblocks.
Priority Setting - Quick to identify most critical information/tasks and respond appropriately.
Process Management – Able to define, work within, and improve business processes based on immediate and future business needs.
Managing Relationships - Transparent and direct while developing strong professional rapport with co-workers, clients, and contractors. Actively engages in collaboration to solve problems when necessary.
Integrity and Trust – Demonstrates alignment with NOV’s Shared Values through words, actions, and behaviors.
Functional/Technical Learning - Able to comprehend, assess and apply global technical information, industry techniques, and/or Best Management Practices (BMPs).
Business Acumen - Able to discern who are the Organization’s stakeholders who influence and facilitate short-term and long-term goals and operations.
Passion for sustainability issues and corporate responsibility preferred.
TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES’
Advanced to Expert in Microsoft Suite
Oracle JD Edwards experience preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
General experience utilizing business intelligence platforms and data visualization, such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.

Design data visuals which effectively communicate progress on the major DPS priorities to district, school, and department leaders to ensure that decision-making is supported by analysis and reporting.

Manage, mine and analyze large data sets such as state test results of student achievement. Clearly communicate findings in compelling ways and in clear, easy to understand graphical representation
(charts, graphs, etc.) to district-wide audiences, the Board of Education and the general public.
Develop and present a variety of training sessions for district and school leadership to inform district policies and practices. Provide managers and leaders with increased capacity to analyze data
and communicate data with the goal of supporting DPS priorities and decision-making.
Maintain both the integrity and confidentiality of all data, research and analyses.
Serve as the primary point of contact for identified focus area(s), and assist the team with other analyses, projects and research efforts (as requested).
Assist district and department leaders in organizing and aligning intended short-, medium-, and long-term goals and indicators of success (e.g., logic models, KPI, and evaluation planning).

Knowledge, Experience & Other Qualifications:

One (1) plus years research or evaluation in education or other social policy.
Strong attention to detail.
Effective time management and organizational skills.
Effective communication skills.
Work collaboratively with others on a team.
High degree of integrity in handling confidential information.
Aptitude for variety and changing expectations and fast-paced environment.
Experience and proficiency with Google Suite.
Effectively handle multiple demands and competing deadlines.
The ability to take responsibility for one’s own performance.
Ability to work in a multi-ethnic and multicultural environment with district and school leaders, faculty, staff and students.
Knowledge of program evaluation best practices, including supporting skills (e.g., data analysis, tool development, logic model design, data gathering).
Ability to present highly technical program evaluation and/or research processes, data and procedures to non-technical audiences.

Bachelor's Degree in Data Management & Analysis.
Master’s Degree in Economics, Sociology, Psychology (social, cognitive, education), Mathematics, Education or other related fields (preferred).

The Data Quality Engineer is responsible for the testing of data sets used within internal data systems and ensures standardization, consistency, and accuracy of data. People in this role are responsible for defining requirements and testing plans on data integrated from internal/external data source applications to the company’s data warehouse. As part of the integration/data team, the data quality engineer must be highly effective in collaborating with business subject matter experts (SME), other IT departments, and 3rd party contractors (where needed) in planning and delivering on prioritized business needs.
What you will do:
Works with team to “deconstruct” legacy processes/code/applications to identify core data needs and translate them into actionable business requirements. (How is data sourced? How is it created? How it is used? Where is it used? How should it be structured for consumption?).
Creates detailed and actionable development/enhancement stories based on clearly defined business requirements.
Validates data contents, identifies defects/inconsistencies, and validates the correction of identified defects.
Proactively solves problems and suggests process improvements.
Creates and maintains solution and design documentation.Creates and maintains Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERDs).
Creates and maintains dimensional modeling (i.e., star or snowflake cluster modeling) with relationship mapping of primary, foreign, and relational keys.
Documents Object/Table Taxonomy and schema descriptions.
Documents process flow of manipulations/transformations.
Works with end-users to ensure they are familiar with the use of tables within the company data warehouse.
Actively collaborates and solicits feedback from identified business partners.
Acts as the subject matter expert (SME) on both the structure and validation of data contained within the Data Warehouse.
Perpetuates industry best practice philosophy across all teams.
What we are looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or information Systems or 3+ years’ experience with data validation and analysis.
Experience with the use and application of agile methodology.
At least five years of advanced experience in using data systems. Relational Data Management Systems RDMS (specifically, MSSQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL, and Salesforce) and Object-Oriented Storage Systems (Amazon S3 experience is preferred).
Skilled in creating complex and well-structured SQL queries. Experience in sequencing merges, inserts & updates.
Ability to create and document testing plans, including testing results.
Effective collaboration skills and ability to develop strong interdepartmental relationships.
Strong written, verbal, and communication skills. With the ability to be persuasive, confident, and content expert on subject matter.
Effective time management skills and proven ability to deliver within defined timelines.
Experience in the use of MS Office suite.
Experience in using issue tracking system software (i.e. JIRA) preferred.
Benefits:
401(k).
Dental Insurance.
Health insurance.
Vision insurance.

The Data Privacy Analyst will be part of the Donaldson Privacy team and the larger Donaldson Legal and Compliance organization – a highly collaborative and effective team that helps fulfill Donaldson’s commitment to advancing filtration for a cleaner world and making a positive impact on our communities.
In this newly created role, the Data Privacy Analyst will partner with the Director of Global Data Privacy to define and evolve the Donaldson Privacy Program while working closely with IT, HR, Sales & Marketing partners and others.
Role Responsibilities:
Support and mature Data Subject Access Request intake and fulfillment processes
Support and mature privacy contract language implementation and update processes
Partner with IT Security and Enterprise Architecture to evolve vendor/project risk assessment process to embed privacy by design principles and enable the creation of Records of Processing, Privacy Impact Assessments, and Data Transfer Impact Assessments
Work globally and cross functionally to translate regulatory privacy requirements and principles into practice
Assist Privacy Director and Privacy Counsel with incident management and any required regulatory reporting
Help develop Privacy training and share leadership in the education of business units and functions on critical Privacy topics.
Minimum Qualifications:
2+ years of experience as a data privacy professional with knowledge and understanding of current and emerging global privacy laws and regulations OR 2+ years of technical project or program management experience and a desire to learn privacy requirements
Bachelor's degree
Ability and desire to learn new technologies and data flows quickly to help assess privacy risks and develop appropriate risk mitigation elements
Ability to help translate regulatory requirements and legal advice into operational privacy requirements and provide practical guidance to business units and functions on those requirements
Experience in collaborating among cross-functional and global teams with ability to drive and manage multiple simultaneous projects
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in information systems, business, or communications or related experience in regulatory or IT compliance
Information technology experience
Relevant privacy certification(s) such as: CIPP, CIPM, CIPT
Additionally, in order to be successful in role, you should have:
The desire and ability to pay careful attention to details and drive for results
Excellent organizational & time management skills
Desire to establish and develop relationships with a wide variety of internal and external clients and partners
Ability and willingness to support hybrid corporate office environment
Ability and willingness to support limited travel
Key Words: Data Privacy, CIPP, CIPM, CIPT

company_name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina
job_description:
Additional Locations:
Job Description
Blue Cross NC is investing in technologists that will allow us to improve the health and well-being of our customers and communities. We are accelerating our digital transformation by scaling out our teams across IT to meet these ambitious but credible goals. If you have a heart to serve our customers and a passion for innovation, this is where you should look. In our roles, you will make a direct difference to our customers, you will make an immediate impact to our teams and solutions, and you have the potential of making a positive and lasting impact to our strategy and solutions long-term.

IT is different here. Our work as technology specialists pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in health care. You will build solutions that make a real difference in people’s lives. Driven by the importance of their work, our team members innovate to elevate. We’re encouraged to be curious, collaborate, and turn ideas into solutions that can make health care better for all.

In this role, you will join a fast-paced, focused, product-oriented team delivering new capabilities to our internal business customers through enhanced data products and services. Innovation is valued here and you will have the opportunity to think outside the box with a matrixed team of diverse professionals focused on making health care easier, simpler, and less costly for thousands of members here in North Carolina. Bring your skills in Python, Ab Initio, Snowflake, Teradata, AWS and help us not stop until health care is better for all!

If you are ready to make a career out of making a difference, then you are the person for this team.

As a Data Integration Analyst, you will work on a collaborative team to evaluate business requirements, translate the business needs into solutions designs, and author discreet data requirements that our engineering team will leverage to build data assets within the Blue Cross NC data eco system.

Support the development and execution of the Enterprise Data, Analytics and Unified Delivery Strategy across the Blue Cross NC organization by overseeing the evaluation, high level use case development and design of strategic data assets. Support the technical design and delivery of highly complex solutions and delivery of strategic data assets and/or of highly complex solutions using data assets housed within the Blue Cross NC organization.
What You Will Do
Provide business and technical expertise in BCNC data ecosystem to drive enterprise level solutions for highly complex, high visibility and varied business issues, while considering broader impacts of business/architectural decisions to the current and future state Data Ecosystem Environments.
Assist in the development of solutions utilizing varied platforms and technologies and/or strategic data stores to best meet business needs.
Provide consultative support to the business and analytics & insights community (including senior and executive leadership) to facilitate an understanding of the data stored in our BCNC data ecosystem, identify data challenges and gaps, and define conceptual and or logical data solutions that enable achievement of strategic organizational objectives.
Provide both thought and subject matter input to assist project teams and other team members in determining the best approach to developing data assets and fostering a collaborative work environment.
What You Bring
Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
Experience with Data Integration, Data Warehousing, Cloud-based Data Systems, Operational Data Stores and/or Systems Analysis
Advanced SQL knowledge and experience with database technologies such as DB2, Teradata, Snowflake, AWS
3+ years of experience in related field
In lieu of degree, 5+ years of experience in related field
Hiring Preferences
Experience in healthcare or insurance
Experience collaborating effectively with vendors and business partners for solution delivery.

The position is responsible for quantitative analysis on structured pricing products and developing tools and models for forecast and valuation. This role maintains the existing quantitative models and provides detailed report on model results timely and accurately. The position is accountable for continuously improving models, analysis and database across different markets. The candidate must be able to develop and implement advanced modeling methodologies to foster company-wide business decision making. This position also requires establishing close working relationship with other teams across the enterprise.
This position may be filled under the following Grade Levels: Data Analytics Analyst (GL – 04), Senior Data Analytics Analyst (GL – 05), or Staff Data Analytics Analyst (GL – 06). Individuals who demonstrate advanced skills in terms of work experience, education, and certifications may be eligible for the more advanced position.
Functional Expertise:
Analyze and organize key customer data for use in pricing and planning
Manage, improve, and validate existing predicative models, including the running of monthly reports that summarize key forecasting results to be used throughout the organization
Develop new statistical models to support special project analysis as requested
Leveraging innovative technologies such as machine learning and AI techniques to foster data analytical capability and support company growth strategy
Business Acumen:
Understand the importance of Data Analytics to the profitability of the company
Constantly look for ways to improve the current models in multiple markets to mitigate potential model risks and enhance profitability
Thorough knowledge of quantitative methods, statistical models, and optimization concepts and the ability to apply them to business situations
Understand how data can be used and how data quality can be improved to discover and mitigate risks inherent in our business
Engagement:
Exhibit high level of personal responsibility to data analysis
Support internal and external auditing on models and analytics tools
Collaborate with other teams to develop modeling tools and analysis reports and communicate projects results/status to appropriate audience
Partner with management in decision making processes and influence the actions of others to ensure the achievement of business goals
Driving Results:
Collect, organize, and process complex data and information from multiple sources, verify its accuracy, and effectively build analytical models based on the data to enhance business profitability
Drive efficiencies through continuous process improvement without implementing undue complexity
May direct the work of other lower-level professionals
Education, Certifications/Licenses:

Job Description:
People Data Analyst

Job Summary:
Experience in transforming data into actionable reporting and analysis according to established business rules is a must. The People Data Analyst will comply with quality assurance practices to ensure that delivered Human Resources (HR) reports and analysis are complete correct and accurate. Must be able to thrive in a collaborative high-paced and dynamic environment managing both regular deliverables and responding to priority ad-hoc requests. The ideal candidate will have experience in delivering people and talent metrics including but not limited to employee headcount attrition recruiting hiring and demographics.
Supervisory Responsibilities:
This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop and disseminate standard and ad hoc data reports accurately and in a timely manner to stakeholders using data from UKG and other sources to address specific HR challenges and opportunities.

Analyze complex data reports to identify trends patterns and correlations within HR data and provide solutions to enhance the overall employee experience.

Utilize data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau Power BI) to create user-friendly and interactive HR reports that enable self-service analytics for HR users.

Prepare and/or deliver reporting to help manage SOX program for the organization including control development.

Collaborate with HR and Divisional leadership to enable a strong understanding of their people analytics needs and deliver actionable insights.

Use data-driven insights to identify areas for process improvement within HR functions such as learning & development performance evaluation and associate engagement.

Drive decision making and process improvements by providing thorough recommendations to management

Monitor and audit HR data to maintain accuracy and consistency.

Implement data quality control measures.

Safeguard sensitive user information and system data

Document internal processes training manuals and controls

Skills/Abilities:
Advanced proficiency with Excel Access Visio and SQL

Proficient with IBM Cognos or a similar business intelligence application

Capable of using reporting tools to develop complex reports and dashboards

Ability to maintain confidentiality at all times and exercise a high level of discretion

Excellent fact-based decision making analytical skills critical thinking (deductive reasoning and logic) andcreative problem solving

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Strong planning project management and organizational skills

Highly organized responsive and self-motivated

Able to learn new technical applications quickly through self-study

Agile learning and leadership skills with a drive for continuous improvement and efficiency

Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in business computer science data science finance human resources or a related field or equivalent work experience in a similar discipline required

3+ years data analytics experience required

2+ years experience with UKG Pro or similar HRIS as an elevated access user required

Experience analyzing data structures to recommend process and reporting improvements required

Experience with API integrations data manipulation and database management required

Certificates/Licenses/Registration
N/A

Financial Responsibilities (budget revenue)
This position has no budget responsibility authority and/or level of control.

Physical Requirements:
Work is performed indoors with potential for exposure to safety and health hazards related to office work. Could periodically travel to other office and operational sites. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

Courage: We challenge the status quo & drive continuous improvement.
Teamwork: We help support & celebrate each other.

Job Description:
Cocoa Climate Sustainability Data Analyst
Mars has set science-based targets to reduce the company’s greenhouses gases (GHG) emissions (Scopes 1, 2 and 3) and to achieve net zero emissions by 2050. Cocoa is the largest category within the business and plays a major role in enabling Mars to achieve the net zero target. Mars Cocoa Enterprise (MCE) has been implementing several activities that contribute to this goal and has been working to integrate this fully in business processes. This needs to be accompanied by enhanced, transparent, and accessible greenhouse gases (GHG) data analytics.
The Cocoa Climate Sustainability Data Analyst will play a global role to support the Cocoa Climate Sustainability team in developing, deploying, and generating MCE performance data analytics across key topics and KPIs relevant to the climate agenda and to other impact areas. This work ensures the link between the delivery or our sustainability objectives and our visibility of the performance results, strengthening business decision-making, ensuring data and information is actionable for business leaders, and enabling lower-footprint innovation through improved systems and tools. This role is responsible for interpreting complex sustainability data to support improved decision-making processes that will enable the efficient contribution of MCE to Mars net zero target.
Role responsibilities include global sustainability data analysis and reporting, farm-level polygon analysis and integration into Mars systems, impact factor methodology development and carbon footprint tool support. The role requires technical knowledge in a range of sustainability areas, including geographic information system (GIS), life cycle assessment with a core focus on climate, as well as strong capabilities in quantitative data analysis and modeling and systems integration. The ideal candidate will be a data-driven, adaptable, critical thinker who can maintain collaborative cross-functional relationships with other Mars teams, with suppliers and consultants.
What are we looking for?
Degree in business, engineering, data science or a sustainability-related topic.
Minimum 3 years’ experience working in a quantitative data analysis field or discipline, with focus on environmental sustainability, life cycle assessment and GHG accounting.
Experience across data analysis software and systems (SimaPro, Excel, Power BI, Python, etc.).
Geographic information system (GIS) expertise.
Technical knowledge across sustainability topics including GHG accounting and life cycle assessment.
Working understanding of GHG accounting standards and practices.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Data storytelling skills.
Ability to work flexibly with global teams across different time zones.
Occasional travel may be required.
What will be your key responsibilities?
Data Analysis and Reporting
Lead the data analysis and scenario development for GHG accounting in MCE, adopting the full life cycle perspective that is needed in Scope 3 accounting and that is pertinent to MCE. Support tracking MCE climate-specific and other related sustainability performance to meet mainly internal and occasionally external reporting needs. This requires validating, collating and analyzing sustainability data across many continents to provide a comprehensive view of the MCE climate sustainability progress. This role is to engage with cross-functional stakeholders and will work to identify data gaps or issues to help work towards more streamlined and precise climate sustainability data management.
Farm-level Spatial Analysis
Lead farm-level spatial data analysis and integrate related outputs into Mars systems to reduce and report GHG emission reduction from achieving deforestation-free status, monitoring farm-level climate-smart practices and properly allocating emissions to cocoa. This requires, among others, ensuring polygon data received from our suppliers are complete and of high quality. This is to be in collaboration with other functions and with external service providers.
Impact Factor Development and Validation
Responsible for proposing new GHG impact factor methodologies and to help build a library of archetypes for supplier and origin-specific impact factor generation. These include generating impact factors specific to cocoa, considering different origins, agricultural practices, whilst considering carbon sinks and sources such as above and below ground carbon sequestration. This work entails drilling down on Life Cycle Assessment assumptions for cocoa in the World Food LCA Database and enhancing the data considering links between supply chain existing data and the overall impact factor estimates. This work is to be done in collaboration with Mars Inc. global sustainability team, and results are to be used for internal and external reporting.
Carbon Footprinting Tool Support
Support the development and use of a range of tools key for MCE’s ability to deliver on the climate goals over time, helping inform and shape choices and decisions, develop emissions scenarios and build on existing tools such as the Cool Farm Tool.
Making the links with other impact areas
This role will also leverage the existing and developing capabilities to deliver on climate targets to other impact areas, namely: land footprint, water stress and potentially also human rights targets.
What can you expect from Mars?
Work with over 130,000 diverse and talented Associates, all guided by the Five Principles.
Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

Description
Location Site: Salem Hospital Main Campus

Position Type: Full Time
Start Time: 8:00
Pioneering healthcare since 1896, Salem Health is a top workplace offering market-leading pay where you can make a difference in the lives of those in the community where you live. Through incorporation of Lean driven principles, staff are able effect change in the organization to solve problems, and drive continuous improvement.
As an employer of choice, we are devoted to assuring that we provide a safe, healthy, and patient-centric workplace, while keeping staff wellbeing and satisfaction top of mind.
We invite you to learn more about our wonderful community: There’s something about Salem, Oregon!
Your Role With Us:
The primary responsibilities for this position can be divided into three main areas:
1. MMIS Support (60%): In this role, you will manage item master price updates in the Materiel Management Information System (MMIS), including creating and managing Med/Surg contract entries. You will collaborate with the Supply Chain purchasing team to address and resolve price discrepancies within the contracting team. Additionally, you'll be responsible for providing ad hoc reporting and analytic support using the MMIS suite, and you will serve as the primary administrator for the contract management system within the MMIS.
2. Premier Contract Support (20%): This part of your role involves managing national Premier contract renewals, including conducting cost analysis and activating prices. You will also supply spend information for Premier buying programs, such as SUPRASS, and collaborate with the value analysis team to identify the best price strategies across all Premier contracts.
3. Analytic Support (20%): In this aspect of your job, you will analyze data from various sources to gain insights into pricing strategies and market trends. You will also create and manage canned reports to capture utilization trends within specific Med/Surg categories. Furthermore, you will work with the value analysis team to provide spend analytic support and assist in identifying potential value analysis projects.
Overall, this position involves a mix of responsibilities related to managing pricing and contracts within the MMIS, supporting national contract renewals, and performing data analysis to optimize pricing strategies and identify market trends. Your role is crucial in ensuring efficient and cost-effective procurement processes and enhancing the organization's ability to make data-driven decisions.

Ensures accurate data synchronization between Enrollment CRM (Salesforce) and System of Record (Jenzabar Student Information System)
Maintains data integrity through duplicate record consolidation
Collaborates across departments to verify Admissions data and rectify errors as a result of inaccuracies or redundancies
Responsible for Admissions Import Utility (application processing) throughout the day
Responsible for cleanup and maintenance of incoming Inquiry and Applicant student data in Salesforce
Conducts frequent data audits to ensure integrity of Admissions and Enrollment Data
Meeting identified enrollment goals to include applicant to admitted and admitted to enrolled yield goals
Creating admissions statistical reports and data for LAPU, as requested.
Compile and analyze statistical reports to identify trends and predictive factors in the admissions process and determine scope of analytical solutions by providing recommendations and solutions based on data driven analytics.
Prepares and maintains weekly applicant, admissions, enrollment, and program reports
Collaborating with LAPU staff to develop and maintain a streamlined admissions process.

Develop and update knowledge and documentation on admissions processes and policies,
Use knowledge and data to determine possible areas for improvement, propose and follow through on improvement initiatives.
Interdepartmental and Customer Interaction
Serving as the lead liaison to various University departments, regarding Admissions and Enrollment data.
Serving as a liaison to the Registrar and Student Financial Services Staff for documentation, enrollment and student statuses
Collaborate with various Registrar departments (internally and externally) to establish and maintain streamlined processes for obtaining and managing transcript requests and receipts
Partner with Business Office to implement and document transcript orders and receipts
Identify areas of greater collaboration between enrollment and other university departments.
Interact and correspond directly with applicants and students regarding their admissions progress and document statuses.
Missional Expectations
All employees play a critical role in the establishment and maintenance of a robust Christian community that seeks to serve with grace the needs of all employees and students. As a LAPU employee you are called to engage with your colleagues and all those that the university serves by modeling Christ-like character in all of your interactions. You will celebrate and honor other employees and students as being made in the image of God; be thankful, expressing gratitude to God and one another; build others up with your words; and work as an instrument of God's love seeking to heal a lost and broken world.

Self-starter with the ability to work in a team-based, fast-paced atmosphere
Ability to interpret, adapt, and apply guidelines and procedures in a complex university setting
Ability to be proactive, take ownership of assigned responsibilities, and work with little supervision
A positive, cooperative, Christ-like attitude supportive of the University and its mission
A “servant’s heart” that delights in providing the highest quality academic support services

Ability to investigate, analyze information, and draw conclusions
