job_title: Recruitment and Retention Data Analyst - SFPD (1823)
company_name: City and County of San Francisco
job_description:
Company Description

Who We Are: The San Francisco Police Department was established in 1849 and continually strives to become a more effective, inclusive and modern police department, while earning the trust and pride of those we serve and those who serve. Our goal is to reflect on current SFPD initiatives, assess best practices across the country, and evaluate the changing environment in policing and within the City to arrive at a strategy statement that the Department and our community can embody every day.
The San Francisco Police Department stands for Safety and Respect for All. We will engage in just transparent unbiased and responsive policing. We will do so in the spirit of dignity and in collaboration with the community. And we will maintain and build trust and respect as the guardians of Constitutional and human rights.
The San Francisco Police Department is committed to excellence in law enforcement and is dedicated to the people, traditions and diversity of our City. The department provides service with understanding, response with compassion, performance with integrity and law enforcement with vision. The department has grown into a nationally known police department providing law enforcement services to one of the most recognized cities in the United States.
Application Opening: October 13, 2023
Application Deadline: Apply immediately, announcement may close anytime two weeks from posting date
Class & Compensation: $113,386 - $137,800
Recruitment ID: PEX-1823-125978
Work Location: SFPD Headquarters, 1245 3rd Street, San Francisco, CA 94158
Work Schedule: Monday - Friday, 9:00am – 5:00pm, Telecommuting work schedule available inline with CCSF policy.

Job Description

Under general direction, the Recruitment and Retention Data Analyst will plan, organize, lead and/or participate in complex, sensitive, and detailed analytical work relating to recruitment, retention, and other staffing and human resources related data. The analyst will leverage analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain solutions to address these areas.
Essential Duties:
Develop and implement data collection and reporting procedures regarding recruitment and retention activities.
Conduct data analysis and data visualization activities; develop dashboards and presentations using data visualization software (PowerBI or Tableau) to understand employment trends.
Use a variety of data analysis tools (e.g., queries, exports, pivot tables, definitions, visualizations, and data quality assessments) to understand SFPD employment data.
Analyze existing and proposed administrative policies and procedures as well as organizational problems.
Prepare and present reports, dashboards, and presentations to internal and external stakeholders.
Research best practices and make recommendations.
Performs related duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications

1. Education: Possession of a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university
AND
2. Experience: Three (3) years full-time equivalent experience performing professional-level analytical work. Qualifying professional-level analytical work includes analysis, development, administration, and reporting in major programs and functions of an organization in the areas of budgets, contracts, grants, policy, or other functional areas related to the duties of positions in the 182X Class series.
Substitution: Possession of a graduate degree (Master's degree or higher) from an accredited college or university with major coursework in specialized subject matter areas such as public or business administration, management, business law, contract law, public policy, urban studies, economics, statistical analysis, finance, accounting or other fields of study closely related to the essential functions of positions in the Class series may be substituted for one (1) year of required experience.
Additional experience as described above may be substituted for the required degree on a year-for-year basis (up to a maximum of 2 years). Thirty (30) semester units or forty-five (45) quarter units equal one year.
One year of full-time employment is equivalent to 2000 hours. (2000 hours of qualifying work experience is based on a 40-hour work week.) Any overtime hours that you work above forty (40) hours per week are not included in the calculation to determine full-time employment.
Verification of Education and Experience: Applicants may be required to submit verification of qualifying education and experience at any point during the recruitment and selection process. If education verification is required, information on how to verify education requirements, including verifying foreign education credits or degree equivalency, can be found at https://sfdhr.org/how-verify-education-requirements
Note: Falsifying one’s education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification for this and future job opportunities with the City and County of San Francisco.
All work experience, education, training and other information substantiating how you meet the minimum qualifications must be included on your application by the filing deadline. Information submitted after the filing deadline will not be considered in determining whether you meet the minimum qualifications.
Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of a completed City and County of San Francisco application.
Applications completed improperly may be cause for ineligibility, or disqualification.
Applicants must meet the minimum qualification requirement by the final filing date unless otherwise noted.
Background Investigation: Prior to employment with the San Francisco Police Department, a thorough background investigation will be conducted to determine the candidate’s suitability for employment. The investigation may include, but not be limited to: criminal history records, driving records, drug/alcohol screening, and other related employment and personal history records. Reasons for rejection may include use of controlled substances and alcohol, felony conviction, repeated or serious violations of the law, inability to work with co-workers, inability to accept supervision, inability to follow rules and regulations or other relevant factors. Candidates may be required to undergo drug/alcohol screening, and must clear Department of Justice and Federal Bureau of Investigation fingerprinting. Criminal records will be carefully reviewed; candidates who do not report their complete criminal records on their applications will be disqualified. Applicants will be fingerprinted.

Additional Information

Recruiter Information: If you have any questions regarding this recruitment or application process, please contact the Staff Services analyst, Danny Wan at danny.wan@sfgov.org.

Data Analyst
Fort Walton Beach, FL
SUMMARY:
Founded in 2001, Indigo IT is an award-winning information technology consulting and services company. We are a trusted services provider to government agencies seeking innovative Cloud, Cybersecurity, Knowledge Management, and Enterprise solutions. We know our defense, federal, and civilian customers have critical IT infrastructures that must remain reliable, available, and maximized. Indigo IT is mission focused and committed to maintaining a sense of urgency in anticipating and supporting our customers’ technology goals and objectives. Our unique ability to think beyond today allows our clients to stay ahead of their IT challenges. Recognized on the 2020 & 2021 Inc. 5000 list of America’s fastest growing companies, we are always looking to hire top talent in the field - come join us today!
Brief summary:
Scope. The IDST will be based on a hub and spoke concept of operations with analysts permanently positioned or on Temporary Duty (TDY) status at the USSOCOM HQ, TSOC, Component Commands, Special Operations Joint Task Forces (SOJTF), Combined Joint Special Operations Task Forces (CJSOTF), Special Operations Task Forces (SOTF), and Special Operations Command Forward Elements (SOCFWD). The IDST contractors/analysts will vary in skill sets ranging from Data Scientists to Data Integrators and will provide support to IDST leadership during recurring planning events, customer requirement discussions, and capability development in line with their respective positional technical requirements. IDST contractors will operate and conduct analysis on SOFNET-U, SOFNET-S, JIANT, SOIS, SOCRATES, NSAnet, and in some cases on the commercial internet. The team, at a minimum will be comprised of Data Integrators, Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Scientists, System Architects, Data Engineers, and Front-End Developers.

Technical Requirements. Specific requirements are based on position classifications. Key positions and requirement expectations are identified in sections 4.1 and 4.2. From the J2 perspective, the IDST contractor will require and possess advanced analytical knowledge of data and be capable of conducting big data analysis; performing data conditioning; programming advanced computing; developing algorithms, software and AI/ML models; executing advanced analytics; and utilizing visualization tools to take advantage of the growing volume of available information.
From the J2 perspective, the DST contractor will require and possess advanced analytical knowledge of data and be capable of conducting big data analysis; performing data conditioning; programming advanced computing; developing algorithms, software and data models; executing predictive analytics; and utilizing visualization tools to take advantage of the growing volume of available information. In addition, the IDST will be gathering voluminous amounts of raw data, based on Government directed requirement(s) and providing this data in the form of information or knowledge by combining complex algorithms to organize and structure it. The specific requirements and deliverables of the SOF DST are to deliver a hub and spoke structured team of Data Science professionals that are educated in various aspects of Data Science and able to assist SOF Intelligence Analysts throughout the SOF Intelligence Enterprise with access, manipulation, and visualization of data. This team exists to support the analysts in asking the correct questions of the data and is built to create an entity that consolidates the competencies of computer science, advanced mathematics, and knowledge of the SOF Intelligence Enterprise to the fingertips of the SOF Intelligence Analysts. The team, at a minimum will be comprised of Data Scientists, System Architects, Database Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Integrators, and Front-End Developers.
There are 60 FTEs required to support this effort.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES:
Data Analysts use technology to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data from various sources and platforms in order to collect, analyze, and compile data to meet customer needs.
Performance Duties:
Identify new sources of data and methods to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting
Collect customer requirements
Determine technical issues
Design algorithms and data manipulation capabilities using R, Python, C++, JavaScript, Go, and other known programming languages.
Build data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers to monitor and report on data.
Improve the quality of data use and usability by driving an understanding and adherence to the principles of data quality management including metadata, lineage, and business definitions
Work collaboratively with Intelligence and Data analysis teams to produce qualitative and quantitative data that support Intelligence products.
SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:
Required Skills: Python
Preferred Skills (not limited to): Python, JavaScript, R, C/C++, SQL, Go, Flask, React, SQLAlchemy, CI/CD
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & CERTIFICATIONS:
Possess a minimum of a bachelor's degree in a computer science discipline or equivalent.
Experience providing services similar in required tasks, scope, and complexity.
Current DoD Top Secret clearance and eligible for SCI access and ACCM read-on.

Indigo IT is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

Description:

Bay Cities is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights and driving data-informed decision-making across the organization. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, possesses strong analytical skills, and has a passion for translating data into meaningful business outcomes.
Responsibilities:
1. Data Collection and Analysis
Gather, consolidate, and validate data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Analyze complex datasets using statistical techniques and data mining methods.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations to derive meaningful insights and recommendations.
Develop and maintain data models, reports, and dashboards to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Perform ad-hoc data analysis as requested by stakeholders.
2. Data Visualization and Reporting:
Create visually appealing and interactive reports and dashboards to present key indings to stakeholders.
Develop data visualizations using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or other relevant software.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.
3. Data Quality & Governance:
Implement data quality assurance measures to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and consistency of data.
Collaborate with IT and other teams to identify and resolve data quality issues.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of data governance frameworks and best practices.
4. Business Insights and Decision Support:
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
Translate complex data findings into clear and concise recommendations to drive business outcomes.
Conduct root cause analysis and provide insights to support strategic planning and process improvements.
5. Continuous Learning and Innovation:
Stay updated with the latest industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis and visualization.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation to enhance data analysis efficiency.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or related disciplines. A master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a track record of successfully delivering data-driven insights.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with large datasets and perform complex data analysis.
Experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar software.
Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python, SAS).
Solid understanding of data governance and data quality principles.
Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information to non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Join our team at Bay Cities and leverage your data expertise to drive strategic decision-making and contribute to the growth and success of our organization.

About Human Trafficking
About Violence Against Women Act
Will serve as a member of the Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) & Human Trafficking team by assisting the section in planning and conducting special research and data management projects. Projects will include the development of a comprehensive data collection system designed to measure the prevalence of human trafficking and intersecting VAWA crimes in South Carolina. This project will include the South Carolina Human Trafficking Task Force mandated member agencies and stakeholders in multiple professional sectors. Develop policies and procedures for managing, verifying, and maintaining the data. Conduct quantitative, qualitative, and mixed-methods research in collaboration with the Task Force Data & Research Subcommittee, higher education partners, and other relevant interested parties. Analyze data for trends, gaps, and other relationships. Produce ad hoc reports. Develop more all-inclusive written reports and communicate the findings of data analysis. Help guide the State Task Force's strategic response to human trafficking and regional task force initiatives using such data analysis.
Develop a comprehensive data collection system to assess the prevalence of human trafficking and its intersection with other crimes in South Carolina.
Acquire data from other VAWA crimes (domestic violence, sexual assault, stalking, and harassment) to analyze the intersections and determine trends, gaps, and other relationships.
Filter and clean data. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets.
Analyze data using statistical techniques and provide ad hoc and all-inclusive reports.
Work with the Director, Deputy Director, the Data and research Subcommittee, and other subcommittee chairs to locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Plans and conducts special research projects in partnership with State Task Force Subcommittees, higher education partners, and other interested parties involved in anti-human trafficking efforts. Conduct research for special projects as needed.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
This position also includes an excellent benefits package:
Public Service Loan Forgiveness eligibility.
Paid parental leave (effective October 1, 2022).
Health, dental, vision, long-term disability, and life insurance for employees, spouses, and children.
Fifteen days annual (vacation) leave per year.
Fifteen days of sick leave per year.
Thirteen paid holidays.
State Retirement Plan and Deferred Compensation Programs.

A bachelor's degree and professional experience involving the collection, analysis, interpretation, and presentation of quantified data. A master's degree in statistics may be substituted for the required work experience.

Interest and/or familiarity with issues related to the Violence Against Women Act is a plus.

Position may require overnight travel.
Position may require employee to work evenings and weekends.
Position requires a valid driver’s license and frequent driver duties.
Position may be required to travel and transport files

Entity Data Analyst
- (3259652)

About Us:
As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.

We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Mass General Brigham is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.

Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.

General Summary/ Overview:
The Mass General Brigham Office of the Chief Medical Officer (OCMO) is seeking a data analyst who has a passion for healthcare data and will thrive as a member of an experienced, high performing and highly motivated team. This individual will possess a willingness to learn and an ability to adapt to the rapidly changing analytic and reporting needs of our system. The ideal candidate has both strong analytical skills and communication skills, as well as experience working with health care data.

Reporting to the Entity Analytics Manager, the data analyst will be a member of a cross-functional team that is responsible for developing new clinical data products using cloud-based technologies. The data analyst will have a dedicated focus supporting the Mass General Brigham entities and develop a strong understanding of the various workflows at the Academic Medical Centers (AMCs), Community Hospitals, and Specialty Care facilities.

The data analyst will be responsible for performing ad hoc and recurring analyses as well as prototyping code to contribute to the development of curated data models and to expedite dashboard development. The areas of focus include Quality and Safety, Provider Wellbeing, Community Health and Health Equity, Patient Experience, Credentialing, and Pharmacy and Formulary.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Work with a cross-functional team to understand functional product requirements and deliver on strategic data and analytics initiatives
Develop subject matter expertise in workflows at the Academic Medical Centers (AMCs), Community Hospitals, and Specialty Care facilities
Prototypes code to help aid in development of fit for purpose data models as well as sample queries to help expedite dashboard development
Completes thorough quality assurance procedures ensuring accuracy, reliability, trustworthiness, and validity of work
Functions as a subject matter expert for data sources within the OCMO scope of responsibilities
Supports the development of technical and business definitions for all data products
Performs ad hoc analysis of clinical data to support the team & stakeholder needs
Present analytical findings in a variety of formats (reports, PowerPoint, graphs, figures, tables) formulate recommendations, and effectively communicate results to non-analytic audiences
Use/s the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned

Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, informatics, statistics, or related field and an interest in healthcare and the use of technology to support clinical care
0-3 years of experience working with healthcare data
0-3 years of experience working at a hospital or specialty care facility strongly preferred
Epic application or database experience is preferred
Experience querying complex data structures using SQL is required
Working knowledge of Azure, AWS, Snowflake or similar experience is preferred
Relevant skills and experience may be substituted for job requirements

Skills/Abilities/Competencies:
Ability to function effectively and independently in a fast-paced environment, organize and prioritize work independently, and meet tight deadlines
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, set priorities, and collaborate with team members and others throughout the organization
Possess strong interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with cross functional teams including staff at all levels of the organization

RVO Health is looking to grow our Talent Analytics team by adding a Data Analyst. 11000 Optum Cir Eden Prairie, MN 55344
What You'll Do
As a Data Analyst, you'll help create analytical tools, such as self-service BI products and interactive dashboards, that visualize and analyze data.
We're tight-knit, fast-paced and even faster-growing teams working with a large amount of complex data. In this role, you'll build powerful visualizations, unearth actionable insights, and help grow our growing organization.

Conduct hands-on, advanced analytics using multiple data sources originating from different applications and different systems
Build relationships with our teams and data science teams to identify new opportunities for deep analytics within the Human Capital organization
Work with market data to drive our compensation approach

Strong analytical ability with experience demonstrating an aptitude to compile data in comprehensive reports, analyze trends, and make fact-based recommendations.
Data visualization with a tool like Tableau or Looker to build dynamic/scalable dashboards and reports.
Experience with data extraction, manipulation, and blending across different data sources (Google Analytics, DoubleClick for Publishers, SQL Server, Snowflake, AWS, Salesforce, flat files, etc).
Writing SQL queries against complex databases for data extraction.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize data into actionable insights and communicate recommendations to leadership
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with experience working well with business stakeholders

Statistical programming knowledge (e.g., R or Python) is preferred
Team-oriented, success-driven, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude.

*THIS IS AN ON-SITE POSITION. MUST BE ABLE TO COMMUTE TO EDGEWOOD, MD*
Seeking qualified candidate for a Demand Data Analyst vacancy. This position supports the plant by collaborating across the organization to ensure efficient and effective management of customer demand data. The Data Analyst is accountable for gathering data, turning data into information, turning information into reports and metrics, and turning reports and metrics into business direction and decisions. This is a high-visibility and influential role within a fast-paced, growing organization.
The selected individual will be responsible for but not limited to the following obligations:
Reviewing/challenging/maintaining 3rd party sales forecast in the demand system (Sales Forecast), coordinating with Product Management and Sales on forecast requirements, analyzing forecast vs. program usage and build rates, and adjusting the data accordingly in order to develop the most accurate view of near and long term demand
Analyzing historical product demand patterns, trends and other business information from a global team of Sales and Customer Service Representatives in the development of monthly/quarterly/annual demand views.
Actively contributing to monthly, quarterly, annual meetings and processes by completing data analysis and preparing tables and charts for management presentation
Maintaining business dashboards and lead weekly meetings to inform and support Product Management and Finance
Regularly perform ad hoc data analysis to support tactical and strategic business decisions
Developing metrics and reports to track forecast accuracy and present findings to Sales, Product Management, Supply Chain, and Operations to drive business strategy
Consolidating and validating near-term forecast data into a consensus view and delivering it to Operations to drive MRP production planning processes
Contributing to short and long term Plant capacity analysis to ensure alignment of customer needs and commitments
Identifying new forecast analysis techniques and methodologies to upgrade/simplify/automate existing forecasting models and tools
Managing demand Risk & Opportunity data to actively promote direction for maximum financial results
Identifying problems or areas for improvement in business processes, develop proposals for resolving these issues, and serve as project lead to see them through to completion
Supporting customer calls and visits to collaborate on improved forecasting and commercial business processes
Serving as Project Manager for multiple customer capacity study requests and assessments to include coordination of any necessary clarification to present summary results to customers
Performing systems administrator role for Enovia (Password management, trouble-shooting etc.) – Configuration control and management system
Reviewing and approving RFQs/POs for export compliance
Reviewing visitor’s citizen/green card status for approval to visit TGC-MD Plant
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Math, Statistics, Engineering, Supply Chain Management or similar field
Experience in data mining, analysis, and reporting
Demonstrated proficiency with Excel (advanced), Access, PowerPoint, and SQL
Experience with ERP systems (knowledge of Visual & SAP preferred)
Familiarity with ITAR/EAR and other export regulations
Strong Project management skills interfacing with multiple departments along with Aerospace customer interface skills
Understanding of continuous and batch planning techniques, item configuration, and BOM structures
Self-motivated and goal oriented
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally and simultaneously balance multiple competing objectives
Demonstrated ability to prepare reports of findings, illustrating data graphically and effectively translate complex findings into written and verbal communication
3 years of relevant work experience
Experience in materials or manufacturing preferred
APICS certification desired
COMPUTER SKILLS
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Inventory software; Fourth Shift, MRP System software and Excel Spreadsheet and Access software a must.
Eligible candidate must be: U.S. citizen, U.S. national, a person lawfully admitted for permanent residence, a temporary resident under sections 210(a) or 245(A) of the Act, a person admitted in refugee status, a person granted asylum.
